Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Lovehoney Group


Berlin, Germany
Full-time
Hybrid
No Salary Information Available


Posted 33 days ago

Apply for this job

Lovehoney Group, a leader in sexual wellbeing, seeks to transform pleasure into innovative experiences through data-driven insights. Operating with a diverse team of over 800 global employees, the company values creativity and diversity. The Junior Data Analyst position is vital to enhancing data insights for business strategies.

In this role you can expect to have the responsibilities:


Utilize SQL and Python for analysis and problem-solving.
Develop and maintain data visualizations for communication.
Evaluate e-commerce KPIs to guide business decisions.
Ensure accuracy and reliability in data stewardship.
Collaborate with diverse teams to identify data needs and insights.
Effectively communicate complex analyses to non-technical audiences.


This Role Comes With The Following Benefits


Hybrid work model with flexibility in-office and remote.
Discounts at retailers and 50% off Lovehoney products.
25+ days of holiday with additional days for tenure.
Customized training and biannual feedback cycles.
Gym benefits and mental wellbeing support.


This Role Requires You To Have


Proficiency in Big Query and SQL.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Experience in building data visualizations.


You Would Benefit From Having


Experience with Python for Airflow.
Familiarity with GIT.
Knowledge of data warehousing best practices.


Lovehoney Group values diversity and inclusivity, ensuring fair evaluation based on skills. They utilize AI in the recruitment process and offer options for accommodation during interviews. The hybrid work model requires three in-office days weekly.

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Business Analyst (d/m/w) to join our Business Engineering Team, that is responsible for analyzing and modifying existing software as well as for empowering, sharing and transforming data in our AUTO1 Group Logistics Department. In this Department you revolutionize car transports across Europe with us.

AUTO1 Group is Europe’s leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de and AUTO1.com.

Job Description


Build reports and analysis for top management in order to enable them to identify focus areas and evaluating performance
Create dashboards / tools to support operational teams and local countries to foster efficiency, manage potential issues and enable them to implement new processes
Work on ad hoc analysis to support decision-making on new features development / product settings and external negotiations
Help structuring the data model to enable its proper usage company-wide and boost our internal efficiency


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business or similar education with a strong quantitative focus
Faible for numbers and data combined with strong analytical skills with focus on details
Profound knowledge of SQL and Excel
Experience in BI / Data Analytics / Analytics Engineering would be highly appreciated
Knowledge of Python, GitHub, dbt, and a data visualization tool (Looker or Tableau) is a plus
Proactive and solution-focused way of working
Proficiency in English is required for the position


Additional Information


Working from home: after a proper onboarding process, you can work from home up to 3 days a week
You work in Berlin’s trendy Kreuzberg district with several different options for lunch and after-work drinks with your team
International team
Be part of europe's leading digital automotive platform!
Above-average corporate pension plan
Take responsibility and own your topic


Join us, building the best way to buy and sell cars!

You do not meet 100% of the requirements? Take your shot and apply anyway! We offer room for growth and challenges to learn from.

Contact

Joke Hätti

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Join our dynamic Operations Analytics Team! As a cornerstone of our organization, this team serves as a one-stop shop for all data analytics needs related to operations and venues. We pride ourselves on our ability to analyze, automate, and guide other teams, functioning as a consultancy/support mechanism. Our work involves close interactions with upper management, contributing significantly to critical strategic discussions. To excel in this role, you must possess a blend of analytical prowess and exceptional communication skills.

What You'll Be Doing


Conducting in-depth analyses using Looker and Excel to support various operational and venue-related teams.
Automating processes to enhance efficiency across departments.
Providing consultancy and support to operational and venue teams to steer their activities based on data-driven insights.
Engaging in regular exchanges with your manager and contributing to strategic decision-making processes.
Preparing reports, occasionally presenting findings through PowerPoint presentations.


Our humble expectations

Must-Haves:


Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Fluent English skills, both written and verbalStrong analytical skills coupled with the ability to communicate findings effectively.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
A proactive attitude towards problem-solving and continuous improvement.


Nice-to-Have:


Proficiency in SQL and Python


Why Join Us?

Join us and contribute to driving the success of our operations through insightful analytics and strategic support. If you have the right mix of analytical expertise and communication skills, we would love to hear from you!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Looking for an exciting challenge?

Mrge is an intelligent platform for commerce advertising, connecting over 5,500 publishers and 55,000 advertisers across 160+ countries. It integrates advanced tools and technologies to bring ads closer to content, creating value for publishers, advertisers, and users. The company combines five leading entities: digidip (premium publishers), MaxBounty (direct partnerships), shopping24 (product recommendations), SourceKnowledge (CPC platform), and Yieldkit (high reach and performance). This collaborative approach enhances advertising effectiveness across various channels and markets.

We’re looking for a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our growing team at mrge. In this role, you’ll be instrumental in transforming raw data into meaningful insights that inform strategic decisions and enhance customer outcomes. Working closely with engineering, product, and business teams, you’ll refine key data models, develop impactful analyses, and help embed a data-driven culture across the organization.

Your Tasks:


Collaborate with engineering and product teams to monitor, maintain, and optimize business metrics, proactively identifying areas for improvement.
Design and deliver clear, concise reports and dashboards that support strategic planning and performance tracking.
Support the development of forecasting, optimization, and predictive models to inform product and business decisions.
Translate business needs into analytical solutions through close stakeholder collaboration.
Provide strategic insights based on emerging trends and in-depth data analysis.
Contribute to the evolution of our data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.


Your Profile:


2+ years of experience in data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering.
Advanced SQL skills and strong experience with OLAP databases such as Snowflake, BigQuery, or ClickHouse.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Jupyter.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
Strong foundation in either linear optimization techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
Proven ability to turn complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Sharp problem-solving skills and an intuitive understanding of how systems behave in the real world.
Self-starter with the ability to take ownership and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Familiarity with data engineering concepts and workflows is a plus.


Your Opportunity:


Take an active role in shaping an innovative, growth-orientated international corporate group from its early stages; seize the opportunity to become irreplaceable!
Take on responsibility as you become an important part of a young, ambitious, and friendly team with a shared desire to develop its skills.
Enjoy opportunities to work independently, with flexible hours and hybrid remote/office working options.
Enjoy top-notch employee benefits: 30 paid vacation days, the latest tech, individual development plan, prepaid spending card (50€ monthly budget) and much more
Take your skills, talents, and career to the next level as you grow with us.


Have we convinced you? Then we can’t wait to read your application!

All our employees have equal career opportunities at mrge, regardless of gender, origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, or other personal attributes.

Candidates will be considered and selected equally based on their skills, qualification, and the needs of the company.

We know that experience and skills are matters of development and gain while working.

Therefore, we encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet 100% of the requirements for this position.

About Us

A global champion for Commerce Advertising with the vibrant energy of a start-up? A high-tech platform that’s fun to work with – for both employees and clients? A multi-location based company with flat hierarchies, run by an international, multilingual team? Yes, that’s us! At mrge, we connect publishers, advertisers, smart tools and formats to drive additional revenue. Now we are excited about connecting with you.

Are you ready to grow? Then join us on our mission to expand mrge and its entities digidip, shopping24 and Yieldkit through fresh ideas, great talent and true commitment. We’re looking forward to getting to know you!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - People
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst - People to join the People & Culture team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Join the team that champions the employee experience at Delivery Hero. As part of the People & Culture Team, you’ll help attract, develop, and retain top talent, creating a workplace where people feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow. With each initiative you support, you’ll be building a positive culture that fuels innovation, teamwork, and a sense of belonging across our global organization.

You'll collaborate closely with senior business stakeholders, People & Culture Department leaders, and regional P&C teams from across the world, transforming raw data into actionable intelligence. You’ll analyze people data, identify trends, and develop strategies for optimization. Your work will directly impact decision making at Delivery Hero, fueling organizational performance and enhancements in employee experience with the generation of advanced data insights and predictive intelligence. You’ll be a key contributor to improving our operational excellence and strategic planning.


Develop, maintain and improve analytical pipelines to ensure efficient data processing and reporting
Proactively analyze people data to identify trends and establish key performance metrics to monitor areas for improvement and optimization
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise reports and presentations. Translating technical information into digestible content to drive action plans and decision making.
Raise the bar in the data analysis of employees attrition, org design, efficiency drivers, D&I and other key metrics that bring best practices to the People & Culture department.
Drive data literacy training and upskill people partners and other key stakeholders in the use and understanding of people data.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field).
Strong critical thinking, ability to deep dive and fully understand patterns in data
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Superior storytelling, ability to write clear and engaging executive summaries with the conclusions of the data analysis produced
Strong business acumen and understanding of key concepts of human resources would be a plus
Familiarity with languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis and plotting (R, R-shiny, R-markdown, Scikit, Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Jupyter).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Product) | AI-Powered Learning | Berlin (Onsite)

Join One of Europe’s Fastest-Growing EdTech Scaleups




We're on a mission to build the #1 AI learning companion for 1 billion students globally.

Founded by students in 2020, this fast-growing EdTech startup is redefining how young people learn—using AI to create truly personalized, engaging learning experiences. Already trusted by millions of students weekly, the company recently raised €27M in Europe’s largest EdTech funding round in the past three years.




With a world-class team and a bold vision, they're building something generational—and this is your chance to be part of it.




Your Mission: Use Data to Shape the Future of Learning

As a Product Data Analyst, you’ll be at the core of how this company builds world-class AI learning experiences. Your insights will guide what gets built, how it gets built, and why it matters.




What You'll Own

Partner with Product & Leadership to embed data into every product decision
Lead deep-dive analyses that shape personalization, feature design, and strategy
Build tools and dashboards that enable every team to move faster and smarter
Own the reliability and scalability of the data stack (BigQuery, dbt)
Ensure marketing and growth teams have clean, actionable data
Proactively monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines




Your Background

Experience in data, BI, or product analytics (startup or fast-paced environment a big plus)
Strong SQL and BI tool knowledge; Python a bonus
Familiarity with modern data stacks (e.g., dbt, BigQuery)
Clear communicator with strong critical thinking skills
Fluent in English (German a bonus)
Available to work onsite in Berlin (5 days/week with flexibility)




Why Join?

Shape a category-defining AI product that impacts students around the world
Join a mission-driven team of 60+ high-calibre builders
Be part of one of Europe’s most exciting AI startups
Work in an environment where data is at the heart of everything

Show more

Founded by students in 2020, this fast-growing EdTech startup is redefining how young people learn—using AI to create truly personalized, engaging learning experiences. Already trusted by millions of students weekly, the company recently raised €27M in Europe’s largest EdTech funding round in the past three years.


With a world-class team and a bold vision, they're building something generational—and this is your chance to be part of it.


Your Mission: Use Data to Shape the Future of Learning

As a Product Data Analyst, you’ll be at the core of how this company builds world-class AI learning experiences. Your insights will guide what gets built, how it gets built, and why it matters.


What You'll Own

  • Partner with Product & Leadership to embed data into every product decision
  • Lead deep-dive analyses that shape personalization, feature design, and strategy
  • Build tools and dashboards that enable every team to move faster and smarter
  • Own the reliability and scalability of the data stack (BigQuery, dbt)
  • Ensure marketing and growth teams have clean, actionable data
  • Proactively monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines


Your Background

  • Experience in data, BI, or product analytics (startup or fast-paced environment a big plus)
  • Strong SQL and BI tool knowledge; Python a bonus
  • Familiarity with modern data stacks (e.g., dbt, BigQuery)
  • Clear communicator with strong critical thinking skills
  • Fluent in English (German a bonus)
  • Available to work onsite in Berlin (5 days/week with flexibility)


Why Join?

  • Shape a category-defining AI product that impacts students around the world
  • Join a mission-driven team of 60+ high-calibre builders
  • Be part of one of Europe’s most exciting AI startups
  • Work in an environment where data is at the heart of everything

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
SoundCloud empowers artists and fans to connect and share through music. Founded in 2007, SoundCloud is an artist-first platform empowering artists to build and grow their careers by providing them with the most progressive tools, services, and resources. With over 400+ million tracks from 40+ million artists, the future of music is SoundCloud.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work closely with the product and engineering teams to ensure accurate data capture of the experiences we build and then mine the data to generate insights that drive product innovation and monetization. You will use your advanced SQL skills, analytical mindset, and storytelling abilities to uncover user behavior patterns, identify opportunities, and measure the impact of new features/functionality through experimentation. You will also create dashboards and insights reports to communicate your findings and recommendations to various stakeholders, from product managers and engineers to leadership and executives.

Drawing on your strong commercial sense, you’ll partner across functions to shape product and go‑to‑market decisions that fuel the expansion of our content ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Leverage content economics and user behavior data to recommend the right tracks and creators to listeners, define and track KPIs for subscriptions and other revenue streams, and pinpoint opportunities to optimize spend and boost ROI.
Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify the opportunity space for the product teams based on user needs, preferences, pain points & friction in the user journeys.
Lead the charge on hypothesis‑driven testing; creating the infrastructure that fast‑tracks experiments on content curation, listener experience, and interface enhancements to maximize growth.
Communicate data-driven insights & recommendations to product, engineering, design, and leadership teams using clear and compelling narratives, visualizations, and presentations.
Collaborate with other analysts, data engineers, data scientists, and product managers to ensure data quality, consistency, and alignment across different data sources and platforms
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and documentation to share best practices, learnings, and institutional knowledge across the organization.


Background And Experience


5+ years of experience in product analytics, business intelligence, data science, or a related field. Direct experience within Commerce, subscriptions, freemium based businesses, streaming services, Social, Commerce, Gaming is a plus.
Expertise in SQL and experience working with large-scale data sets on cloud platforms such as GCP or AWS.
Experience with analytics engineering tools such as Apache Airflow, Dataform, dbt, etc.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Familiarity with event tracking, design and tag management solutions such as Segment, GTM, Adobe Launch, Tealium, etc.
Experience in designing, running, and analyzing complex A/B tests and experiments using one or more of the leading experimentation solutions. i.e. StatSig / Optimizely / Target.
Strong analytical skills and ability to apply statistical methods such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, clustering, forecasting. Experience building churn and retention prediction models
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations for different audiences.
Curiosity and passion to find & elevate the data narratives and exercise influence to drive change.
Experience in mentoring and training analysts and non technical stakeholders
Passion for music and interest in understanding user behavior and preferences in the music domain.


About Us


We are a multinational company with offices in the US (New York and Los Angeles), Germany (Berlin), and the UK (London)
We provide a flexible work culture that offers the opportunity to collaborate and connect in person at our offices as well as accommodating work from home
We are deeply committed to ensuring diversity, equity and inclusion at all levels of our organization and fostering a community where everyone’s voice, perspective and experience is respected and heard
We believe a strong team is made by investing in employees through mentorship, workshops and enrichment opportunities


Benefits


Not located in Berlin? No worries, we offer extensive relocation support including allowances, one way flights, temporary accommodation and, by partnering with Expath, on the ground support on arrival
Interested in a gym membership, photography course or book? We have a Creativity and Wellness benefit!
Employee Equity Plan
Generous professional development allowance
Fertility and Family Building program
Flexible vacation and public holiday policy where you can take up to 35 days of PTO annually
We offer free German courses at beginning, intermediate and advanced
Various snacks, goodies, and 2 free lunches weekly when at the office


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at SoundCloud

SoundCloud is for everyone. Diversity and open expression are fundamental to our organization; they help us lead what’s next in music by understanding and empowering our creators and fans, no matter their identity. We acknowledge the challenges in the music industry, and strive to influence an inclusive culture where everyone can contribute respectfully and thrive, especially the historically marginalized communities that many of our creators, fans and SoundClouders identify with. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment at SoundCloud for everyone, regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, migration background, national origin, age, disability status, or care-giver status.

At SoundCloud you can find your community or elevate your allyship by joining a Diversity Resource Group. Diversity Resource Groups are employee-organized groups focused on supporting and promoting the interests of a particular underrepresented community in order to build a more inclusive culture at SoundCloud. Anyone can join, whether you share the identity or strive to be an ally.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


Zalando Stores Experiences & Clearance Solutions is a retail-focused business unit, responsible for managing overstock from across the entire Zalando Group. We operate 15 (and counting) physical outlet stores across Germany, the Zalando Beauty Station in Berlin, and various other overstock channels. While retail is at the core of our operations, we increasingly collaborate on initiatives across the wider Zalando Group – expanding our scope and creating new data needs in the process. In recent years, we have strengthened and streamlined our BI landscape, putting in place cleaner data models, stronger governance, and more unified reporting.

As a BI Analyst (all genders) in Zalando Stores, you will build on this foundation – designing and maintaining robust data models, ensuring high-quality KPIs and dashboards, and making our BI tools more impactful and accessible. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into effective BI solutions, and act as a sparring partner to improve the quality and usability of our data products.

The focus now is on building new data products, refining what already exists, and ensuring our BI solutions keep pace with the evolving needs of a fast-changing retail market and our growing cross-Zalando activities.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce - one that is inclusive by design. We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Discover and translate business processes into data models for our data warehouse and Tableau, ensuring they are efficient, scalable, and aligned with current and future business needs.
Write and optimize SQL to create data marts, improve data flows, and support efficient BI performance.
Work with Zalando’s central data teams to ensure data quality, consistent structures, and well-designed ETL processes that support our data needs.
Partner with business stakeholders to design and improve data products that enhance the value and usability of reporting and analysis.
Provide ad-hoc analysis, reporting, and troubleshooting to support operational and strategic decisions.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVE




Strong SQL skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and transform data from a data warehouse.
Hands-on experience designing or reshaping data models and troubleshooting data pipelines.
Solid experience with Tableau, including data source management, dashboard creation, and familiarity with advanced features (e.g., LOD calculations, table calculations).
Strong analytical skills, basic statistical literacy, and a data-driven mindset.
Clear and collaborative communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to organise work, manage deadlines, and handle multiple priorities with guidance when needed.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Lounge by Zalando, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start for full-time employees
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Wellhub, formerly Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review
Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst (Part-Time)
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company, with the mission to elevate pleasure through innovative technologies, a data-driven approach, and foster creative and fresh perspectives on intimacy. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a streamlined online shopping experience.

At Lovehoney, we employ over 800 passionate and progressive individuals across 9 global offices, each person contributing a unique blend of talents to our diverse workforce. We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

Join us at Lovehoney, where pleasure combines with creativity, data, and innovation!

We are currently looking for a part-time Data Analyst to join our team. This role is ideal for someone highly analytical and detail-oriented, who enjoys working with data sets, developing insights, and driving data-informed decisions. You’ll provide actionable insights through meticulous data analysis, supporting strategic decision-making across teams.

What You Will Do


Collect, compile, and clean large and varied data sets, ensuring their accuracy and reliability.
Develop, maintain, and optimize comprehensive reporting dashboards using analytical tools like Superset and Netsuite.
Conduct in-depth data analyses to identify meaningful trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with various internal teams to ensure accurate and insightful reporting that informs strategic decision-making.
Continuously enhance data quality, reporting processes, and analytic methodologies.



What You Should Bring


Experience in data analysis or related data-centric roles. A great benefit if related with sales.
Proficiency in data management, analysis, and visualization; familiarity with Superset and Netsuite is a strong plus.
Strong analytical capabilities, with demonstrated experience in interpreting complex data.
Attention to detail with the ability to ensure high accuracy and clarity in reporting.
Excellent communication skills, capable of translating data insights clearly to different stakeholders.



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, friendly faces and fun team-building events
Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers, in addition to a 50% discount on all Lovehoney products to explore and discover new ways to have fun
Enjoy a hybrid work model that fosters flexibility and work-life balance, with three days per week in-office and the opportunity to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, alongside 25 days’ holiday, plus an additional day for each year you are with Lovehoney, providing ample time for relaxation, rejuvenation, and exploration
Access to customized training opportunities to support your unique learning journey, complemented by biannual feedback cycles, offering valuable insights into your performance and growth areas, enhancing your development within the company.
Recognising the significance of physical and mental health, we proudly provide gym benefits in addition to a mental wellbeing platform, to ensure our employees thrive both professionally and personally.



Our interview process


CV review
Interview with one of Talent Acquisition Team Members
Hiring Manager Interview
Task
Hiring Team Interview



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we embrace innovative technologies to enhance our recruitment process. As part of your application, you'll experience practical, AI-driven tasks designed to reflect real scenarios you'll encounter in the role, helping us understand your strengths and approach. Additionally, we leverage artificial intelligence during screening interviews for CV reviews and note-taking. We prioritize transparency and respect your preferences, so you'll have the option to opt out of recording and AI-driven note-taking while still receiving full and fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
Show more

Title: AI Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


The Operations & Analytics team partners with stakeholders across Merchandising, Buying, Operations, and Products Quality & Safety to inform timely, quality decisions about Zalando’s business with its suppliers. We enable commercial decisions, process improvements, standardisation, and workflow automation.

Are you excited about challenging the status quo, pushing the boundaries, and leveraging data and AI to shape the future of fashion and lifestyle e-commerce? This is your chance!

As an AI Data Analyst, you will take your analytical expertise to the next level, leveraging cutting-edge tech tools to define and track KPIs, explore data sources, analyse complex datasets, and solve critical business problems. You will be part of the world-class Analytics@Zalando community that offers various opportunities to network and share knowledge and best practices.


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


This is where analytical expertise meets excellence to empower our stakeholders to make timely quality business decisions!



Forge trusted partnerships where stakeholders seek your strategic insights, not just your SQL skills. Immerse yourself in your business partners' world to understand their pain points and effectively translate their business questions into analytical problems. By proactively identifying opportunities where data can unlock value and delivering insights that shape decisions, you'll earn a seat at the table where your recommendations directly influence Zalando’s strategy.
Build the foundations for trusted self-service analytics at scale by designing, developing, and maintaining data transformation pipelines and AI models throughout their lifecycle that business stakeholders can confidently adopt, earning trust through data quality and empowerment, enabling stakeholders to independently answer their frequently asked business questions while you tackle more complex analyses and strategic challenges.
Design and develop game-changing AI-powered applications to streamline and automate processes and workflows to enable Zalando’s business growth, improve customer and supplier experience, drive operational efficiency, and maximise profitability.
Actively participate in architecture discussions with engineering teams and senior colleagues in analytics and tech, evaluate trade-offs, and make sound recommendations.




WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You hold a Master’s in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field and gained 5+ years of professional experience in data analytics or data science.
You have proven experience designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using SQL and Python on cloud data warehouses and lakehouses (ideally, AWS Redshift and Databricks), with strong knowledge of orchestration tools (dbt and Apache Airflow).
You are proficient in data visualisation best practices and tools (Tableau, Looker, or MicroStrategy) and have exceptional data storytelling abilities to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and actionable insights to diverse audiences.
You have hands-on experience with statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering), practical GenAI applications, and successfully deployed solutions in production environments.
You uphold rigorous software engineering standards in version control (Git/GitHub), CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), and code documentation best practices.
You exhibit intellectual curiosity and critical thinking to amplify your business impact through strategic integration of AI in your analytics workflows and rigorous evaluation of its output.
You show demonstrated ability to develop profound business understanding, proactively identify opportunities, effectively manage priorities and stakeholders’ expectations, translate business questions into concrete analytical problems, bring industry trends and best practices to the conversation, and make sound data-backed recommendations.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

You will be part of the world-class Analytics@Zalando community that offers various opportunities to network and share knowledge and best practices.


WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


This is where analytical expertise meets excellence to empower our stakeholders to make timely quality business decisions!


  • Forge trusted partnerships where stakeholders seek your strategic insights, not just your SQL skills. Immerse yourself in your business partners' world to understand their pain points and effectively translate their business questions into analytical problems. By proactively identifying opportunities where data can unlock value and delivering insights that shape decisions, you'll earn a seat at the table where your recommendations directly influence Zalando’s strategy.
  • Build the foundations for trusted self-service analytics at scale by designing, developing, and maintaining data transformation pipelines and AI models throughout their lifecycle that business stakeholders can confidently adopt, earning trust through data quality and empowerment, enabling stakeholders to independently answer their frequently asked business questions while you tackle more complex analyses and strategic challenges.
  • Design and develop game-changing AI-powered applications to streamline and automate processes and workflows to enable Zalando’s business growth, improve customer and supplier experience, drive operational efficiency, and maximise profitability.
  • Actively participate in architecture discussions with engineering teams and senior colleagues in analytics and tech, evaluate trade-offs, and make sound recommendations.



WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



  • You hold a Master’s in Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field and gained 5+ years of professional experience in data analytics or data science.
  • You have proven experience designing, building, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using SQL and Python on cloud data warehouses and lakehouses (ideally, AWS Redshift and Databricks), with strong knowledge of orchestration tools (dbt and Apache Airflow).
  • You are proficient in data visualisation best practices and tools (Tableau, Looker, or MicroStrategy) and have exceptional data storytelling abilities to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and actionable insights to diverse audiences.
  • You have hands-on experience with statistical analysis and machine learning techniques (regression, classification, clustering), practical GenAI applications, and successfully deployed solutions in production environments.
  • You uphold rigorous software engineering standards in version control (Git/GitHub), CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins/GitHub Actions), and code documentation best practices.
  • You exhibit intellectual curiosity and critical thinking to amplify your business impact through strategic integration of AI in your analytics workflows and rigorous evaluation of its output.
  • You show demonstrated ability to develop profound business understanding, proactively identify opportunities, effectively manage priorities and stakeholders’ expectations, translate business questions into concrete analytical problems, bring industry trends and best practices to the conversation, and make sound data-backed recommendations.



OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.


  • Employee shares program
  • 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
  • 2 paid volunteering days a year
  • Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
  • Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
  • 27 days of vacation a year to start
  • Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
  • Family services, including counseling and support
  • Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
  • Mental health support and coaching available
  • Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review


Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




The EU Data Analytics team at Trip.com empowers data-driven decisions with accurate, timely, and actionable insights. As a Market Data Analyst, you’ll collaborate with EU Strategists and cross-functional teams to drive business growth.




Joining the analytics team, you’ll own the full lifecycle—from data extraction to generating insights that inform decisions. Your role will include designing tracking systems, creating visualisations, building dashboards, and conducting exploratory analyses.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Conduct integrated analyses of market competition, trends, and business performance to generate actionable insights that fuel growth.
Own and deliver the weekly market report, providing insights on market developments and tracking the progress of key projects.
Partner with strategy, product, growth, and campaign teams across the EU, HQ, and global locations to align efforts with market growth strategies and global business goals.
Proactively identify and quantify key issues, communicating findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a timely manner.
Monitor and analyse critical business metrics, including demand, supply, traffic, funnel conversion rates, and market share.
Identify key market trends and uncover new business opportunities through comprehensive data analysis.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

Experience in the travel industry and a portfolio of past work are a plus.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills across teams and organizations.
A self-starter with a curious mindset, comfortable working in ambiguity and fast-paced environments with minimal oversight.
Strong analytical and statistical skills, with the ability to solve problems, uncover insights, and communicate them effectively to stakeholders.
Strong SQL skills are a must, with proficiency in Tableau, Excel, BigQuery, and Hive for data analysis and visualization.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering).
5+ years of experience in data or business analysis, with a proven track record of delivering actionable insights.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?

Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com







Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Claims Data Analyst/Business Analyst. Healthcare
Description:
Trinetix is seeking analytical and healthcare-savvy Claims Data Analyst / Business Analyst to support projects focused on payer and provider data systems, RCM (Revenue Cycle Management) processes, and data-driven automation initiatives. This role requires a deep understanding of claims data, industry-standard data formats (e.g., 837/835), and the broader healthcare data ecosystem.

The ideal candidate is technology-agnostic, adaptable, and capable of working across systems to analyze trends, identify process gaps, and help implement automated, scalable solutions in healthcare operations.

Requirements


5+ years of experience in a data analysis or business analysis role with a strong focus on claims data.
Solid understanding of 837/835 transaction sets, CPT/ICD coding, adjudication logic, and revenue cycle workflows.
Proven experience working across both payer and provider data systems and data exchange models understanding.
Experience gathering requirements, writing documentation, and conducting business process analysis in healthcare environments.
Familiarity with data querying (SQL) and BI/reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Understanding of HIPAA and healthcare data privacy and compliance regulations.


Nice-to-haves


Exposure to FHIR, HL7, or healthcare data interoperability standards.
Experience supporting RCM automation or process improvement projects (e.g., using bots, scripts, or custom workflows).
Familiarity with cloud-based healthcare data platforms or data lakes.
Experience working with clinical and claims data integration use cases.
Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Informatics, Business, Data Science, or a related field.


Core Responsibilities


Develop new features
Analyze requirements and clarify with BSA
Participate in grooming, estimation, and planning sessions
Collaborate with other team members (FE, QA, TDM, BSA, Architect)
Support existing functionality, refactoring, and bug-fixing


Soft Skills


Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and data integrity.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and translate complex business needs into clear, actionable requirements.
Collaborative, self-motivated, and solution-oriented.


Why Join Us?


Contribute to meaningful projects that improve healthcare financial operations and data quality.
Work alongside healthcare experts, engineers, and innovators in a dynamic, agile environment.
Be part of a mission-driven team focused on modernizing healthcare data ecosystems. Opportunities for growth, leadership, and cross-functional collaboration


About Us

Established in 2011, Trinetix is a dynamic tech service provider supporting enterprise clients around the world.

Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we have a global team of over 1,000 professionals and delivery centers across Europe, the United States, and Argentina. We partner with leading global brands, delivering innovative digital solutions across Fintech, Professional Services, Logistics, Healthcare, and Agriculture.

Our operations are driven by a strong business vision, a people-first culture, and a commitment to responsible growth. We actively give back to the community through various CSR activities and adhere to international principles for sustainable development and business ethics.

To learn more about how we collect, process, and store your personal data, please review our Privacy Notice: https://www.trinetix.com/corporate-policies/privacy-notice

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) 100%
Description:
Die NZZ gehört zu den bedeutendsten privaten Medienunternehmen der Schweiz und mit einer stetig wachsenden Präsenz in Deutschland. Sie konzentriert sich auf qualitativ hochstehende, unabhängige Publizistik und vertritt liberale Perspektiven. Mit ihren Produkten bietet sie ihren Leserinnen und Nutzern täglich Orientierung und Inspiration. Neben den beiden Flaggschiffen «Neue Zürcher Zeitung» und «NZZ am Sonntag» gehören diverse weitere NZZ-Titel, NZZ-Veranstaltungsreihen und TV-Formate zum Portfolio.




Zur Unterstützung unseres Data-Teams in Zürich sowie des Marketing und Sales/E-Commerce-Teams in Berlin, suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung in Berlin eine motivierte und initiative Persönlichkeit als




Data Analyst (w/m/d) 100%




Ihre Aufgaben:

Konzeption, Planung, Umsetzung, Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung von Standard Reporting- und BI-Lösungen sowie KPIs
Entwicklung von Fokus-Reports und ad-hoc Analysen rund um Verkaufsdaten, Marketingaktivitäten sowie Verhaltensdaten zur Entscheidungsunterstützung im Business
Erstellung von Datenvisualisierungen, interaktiven Dashboards und Präsentationen für Management Reporting
Proaktive Analyse von Business Drivers und Impaktanalyse von Marketingaktivitäten
Erstellung von übergreifenden Segmentbewegungsanalysen
Organisation und Durchführung von Schulungen für Tableau und andere Analytics Tools sowie Nutzersupport




Ihr Profil:

Hochschulabschluss (Uni/FH) mit Schwerpunkt in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Datenmanagement, Data Analytics, Marketing oder eine andere vergleichbare Ausbildung
Mind. 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung
Ausgeprägte praktische Erfahrungen mit Reporting- und BI-Tools (z.B. Tableau) sowie SQL
Begeisterung für die digitale Welt und technologische Innovation sowie Leidenschaft für die Medienbranche und die Produkte der NZZ
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, in Wort und Schrift
Reisebereitschaft (ca. 4 – 6 Mal pro Jahr nach Zürich)




Unser Angebot:

Ein facettenreiches und herausforderndes Aufgabengebiet verbunden mit hoher Selbständigkeit
Eine kollegiale und respektvolle Arbeitsatmosphäre mit offener Gesprächskultur, gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Loyalität und Vertrauen
Ambitioniertes Team in Berlin und Zürich
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten sind selbstverständlich
Unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis: Wir setzen auf eine langfristige Zusammenarbeit
Schönes Büro im Herzen des Berliner Regierungsviertels




Ihr Arbeitsort:

Charlottenstraße 42, 10117 Berlin, Deutschland




Ihr nächster Schritt:

Sind Sie interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung unter Angabe Ihrer Verfügbarkeit und Gehaltsvorstellungen (Jahresbruttogehalt, 100%). Sollten Sie Fragen haben oder weitere Informationen wünschen, melden Sie sich bitte bei Isabelle Liechti, HR Business Partner, Tel. +41 44 258 17 09.

Title: Business Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Ihre Aufgaben


KPI-Management & Unternehmenssteuerung: Analyse, Definition und laufende Pflege relevanter KPIs in Abstimmung mit den Fachabteilungen: Erstellung von KPI-Dashboards und Reports inkl. Soll-Ist-Vergleichen und Forecasts.
Datenanalyse & Reporting: Aufbereitung und Transformation großer Datenmengen aus unterschiedlichen Systemen: Entwicklung interaktiver Dashboards und Reports (z. B. Power BI) zur Visualisierung von Kennzahlen.
Microsoft Power Apps-Entwicklung: Entwicklung und Pflege benutzerfreundlicher Power Apps für interne Workflows: Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen mittels Power Automate und Systemintegration.
Python-Entwicklung & Datenautomatisierung: Erstellung von Python-Skripten zur automatisierten Datenverarbeitung und Analyse: Implementierung von Machine-Learning-Ansätzen zur KPI-Vorhersage (Predictive Analytics).
Schnittstellenmanagement & Beratung: Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen zur Umsetzung datenbasierter Lösungen; Durchführung von Schulungen und Workshops zur Nutzung von Analyse- und Reporting-Tools.


Ihr Profil

Fachliche Qualifikationen:


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Betriebswirtschaft, Data Science oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung als Business Analyst, Data Analyst oder in einer ähnlichen Funktion
Sehr gute bis professionelle Kenntnisse in Microsoft Power Apps (inkl. Power Automate und Integration in Microsoft 365-Umgebungen)
Fundierte Python-Kenntnisse, insbesondere im Bereich Datenverarbeitung (Pandas, NumPy, OpenPyXL), Automatisierung und API-Anbindung
Erfahrung im KPI-Management, idealerweise in einem mittelständischen oder internationalen Umfeld.
Sicherer Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL) und Reporting-Tools (z. B. Power BI)


Persönliche Kompetenzen:


Ausgeprägte analytische und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
Hohe Zahlenaffinität und strukturiertes Arbeiten
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten einfach und verständlich zu visualisieren
Kommunikationsstärke und sicheres Auftreten gegenüber Management und Fachabteilungen
Selbstständige, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise


Was bieten wir?


Ein spannendes und internationales Arbeitsumfeld, in dem Sie unsere dynamischen Wachstumsprozesse aktiv mitgestalten können
Förderung Ihrer beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
Eine umfängliche und ganzheitliche Einarbeitung durch unsere Kollegen:innen
30 Urlaubstage
Einen krisensicheren Arbeitsplatz in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen
Herzliche Teams, eine wertschätzende Führungskultur sowie flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege
Eine moderne und zeitgemäße IT-Ausstattung (Laptop, Tablet, Handy) und wir legen großen Wert auf Digitalisierung
Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Homeoffice
Unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag in Vollzeit- und Teilzeit
Arbeiten am Technologiestandort Adlershof


Über uns

ENPROM ist auf den Bau von Hoch- und Höchstspannungsleitungen spezialisiert. Wir planen, bauen und sanieren Freileitungen und Umspannwerke, um den Strom aus erneuerbaren Energien möglichst schnell und verlustfrei zu den Verbrauchern zu bringen. Wir arbeiten täglich daran, das Netz der Zukunft zu gestalten. Mit über 200 hochqualifizierten Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern an drei Standorten sowie auf unseren aktuellen Baustellen in ganz Deutschland setzen wir die Energiewende um. Besonders stolz sind wir auf unsere internationalen Teams, die Menschen aus zehn verschiedenen Nationen vereinen. Gemeinsam setzen wir uns für einen grüneren Planeten ein.

Unsere Mission

# Wir bauen verantwortungsbewusst indem wir innovative Konzepte, hohe Qualität der realisierten Projekte, Verständnis für lokale Interessen und Sorge um den Umweltschutz gewährleisten.

  • Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten einfach und verständlich zu visualisieren
  • Kommunikationsstärke und sicheres Auftreten gegenüber Management und Fachabteilungen
  • Selbstständige, lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise

Was bieten wir?

  • Ein spannendes und internationales Arbeitsumfeld, in dem Sie unsere dynamischen Wachstumsprozesse aktiv mitgestalten können
  • Förderung Ihrer beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung
  • Eine umfängliche und ganzheitliche Einarbeitung durch unsere Kollegen:innen
  • 30 Urlaubstage
  • Einen krisensicheren Arbeitsplatz in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen
  • Herzliche Teams, eine wertschätzende Führungskultur sowie flache Hierarchien und schnelle Entscheidungswege
  • Eine moderne und zeitgemäße IT-Ausstattung (Laptop, Tablet, Handy) und wir legen großen Wert auf Digitalisierung
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten & Homeoffice
  • Unbefristeten Arbeitsvertrag in Vollzeit- und Teilzeit
  • Arbeiten am Technologiestandort Adlershof

Über uns

ENPROM ist auf den Bau von Hoch- und Höchstspannungsleitungen spezialisiert. Wir planen, bauen und sanieren Freileitungen und Umspannwerke, um den Strom aus erneuerbaren Energien möglichst schnell und verlustfrei zu den Verbrauchern zu bringen. Wir arbeiten täglich daran, das Netz der Zukunft zu gestalten. Mit über 200 hochqualifizierten Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern an drei Standorten sowie auf unseren aktuellen Baustellen in ganz Deutschland setzen wir die Energiewende um. Besonders stolz sind wir auf unsere internationalen Teams, die Menschen aus zehn verschiedenen Nationen vereinen. Gemeinsam setzen wir uns für einen grüneren Planeten ein.

Unsere Mission

# Wir bauen verantwortungsbewusst indem wir innovative Konzepte, hohe Qualität der realisierten Projekte, Verständnis für lokale Interessen und Sorge um den Umweltschutz gewährleisten.

Title: Product Analyst (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join the Quick Commerce Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of redefining how customers experience quick commerce. You’ll help build technology that scales our non-food offerings, reaching new market segments and driving revenue growth. By innovating within our Quick Commerce Team, you’ll make Delivery Hero the go-to platform for a broad range of products, helping us grow faster and deliver more value to customers around the world.

You will play a pivotal role in redefining how we leverage data to optimize our quick commerce offerings, directly impacting our ability to scale and grow our DMarts and Local Shops segments. By driving data-driven insights within our Quick Commerce Product Analytics Team, you'll help empower product decisions and ensure our initiatives deliver tangible business value.

You'll partner closely with Product Managers, driving operational excellence and strategic insights across Fulfillment Operations, Supply Chain, Assortment, Pricing, and Integrations. Focusing on metrics monitoring ,deep dive analysis, experimentation, feature reporting, pipeline building and fostering a data-driven culture.

Your insights will directly shape product roadmaps, optimize features, and assess impact. You will define KPIs, design experiments, and communicate findings to senior stakeholders. You'll help us ensure product initiatives deliver measurable business value, transitioning from a reporting mindset to a problem-solving approach. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale and grow our non-food offerings.


Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to define KPIs, track performance, and support product decision-making
Conduct exploratory and descriptive analyses of product usage and adoption patterns to identify insights and improvement opportunities
Support analytics needs across product initiatives, including dashboard development and data pulls
Design and execute experiments(A/B, Quasi-experiment) to optimize product features and user experience
Support the implementation of tracking strategies and ensure data integrity
Generate business intelligence solutions and compelling visualizations to communicate key insights


Qualifications


2–4 years of experience in Product Analytics, Data Analytics, or a similar role, ideally within a digital or product-driven environment
Strong analytical thinking and a willingness to learn more advanced statistical and experimental techniques
Proficient in writing complex SQL and practical experience using Python (or similar) for data manipulation and exploratory analysis as well as expertise in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker Studio, or similar
Hands-on experience running A/B tests and analyzing results, with a solid understanding of experimentation fundamentals and a desire to deepen expertise
Familiarity with web or app tracking tools (e.g., Mixpanel, Amplitude, Segment, GA)
Ability to interpret data and communicate findings in a clear, concise, and actionable way


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team?

If you’re excited to grow, collaborate, and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: PowerBI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Zusammenfassung: Diese Position erfordert die enge Zusammenarbeit mit technischen Projekten, um Reporting-Bedürfnisse zu verstehen und in intelligente, effektive Dashboard-Lösungen umzusetzen. Der Hauptzweck der Rolle besteht darin, Projekt- und programmspezifische Power BI-Dashboards kontinuierlich zu entwickeln und zu verbessern.

Aufgaben:


Enge Zusammenarbeit mit technischen Projekten zur Ermittlung von Reporting-Bedürfnissen
Analyse bestehender Datenquellen und Entwicklung von Strukturierungsmethoden für Reporting
Kombination von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (z. B. Cloud-Plattformen, Excel, APIs) und Vorbereitung für die Nutzung in Power BI
Erstellung und Pflege benutzerfreundlicher, projektspezifischer Dashboards
Einrichtung und Verbesserung der Datenladeprozesse zur automatischen Aktualisierung der Dashboards
Unterstützung von Kollegen durch Schulung und Anleitung zur Nutzung der Power BI-Dashboards


Must Haves:


Hochschulabschluss in Betriebswirtschaftslehre mit Schwerpunkt Analytics oder IT, Ingenieurwesen mit Schwerpunkt Datenanalyse (oder gleichwertige praktische Erfahrung im Umgang mit Daten und Power BI)
Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Power BI und Power Query
Erfahrung im Aufbau von Datenmodellen und interaktiven Dashboards basierend auf Geschäftsanforderungen
Professionelle Sprachkenntnisse in Englisch (mindestens B2) und Deutsch (mindestens B2)


Nice to Haves:


Vertrautheit mit Projektmanagement-Tools wie tp!CDE ist von Vorteil
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x) Customer Success
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:As an intuitive cloud accounting software, we empower founders, self-employed individuals, and small business owners to focus on what truly matters. Our product offers them a smart accounting tool to save time in their daily activities. As a company, we aim for excellence, continuously expand our horizons, and strive for daily improvement of our product and our daily work life. In pursuit of these goals, we rely on our strong culture, innovative spirit, and unwavering passion. In the future, we hope to count you among our dedicated team members.

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our Customer Success Team. With your analysis, you identify optimization potential in the organization and influence our Customer Service and Support roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You analyze user behavior data and use it to support our Customer Success Teams in optimizing customer retention and identifying the most critical customer problems.
You collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to analyze customer-journey touchpoints to continuously improve how our customers interact with our software.
You scrutinize our Service & Support activities, detect shifts in KPI performance, and, in partnership with your stakeholders, translate the findings into data-driven hypotheses and actionable recommendations.
You prepare your findings visually so that it is easy for your stakeholders to incorporate them into their decisions.
You design optimizations in data collection and continuously develop the reporting ecosystem.
You support your colleagues in using product data and help keep our quality standards high with peer reviews
Reporting and analyzing churn prevention activities, onboarding flows, and the impact of customer communications to help the teams boost engagement and retention.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst (m/f/x), preferably in a digital and/or SaaS environment.
You speak German (at least B2) and English (C1)
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics or comparable.
You have experience using data to drive impact, including working with tools such as SQL, Tableau, Looker, Snowflake, Redshift, or comparable platforms.
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, good knowledge of statistics is a plus.
You are proactive, results-oriented, and flexible in problem-solving both in your role and for the company.
Your profile is rounded off by strong communication, presentation, and organizational skills.
Despite your passion for data, you recognize that emotions are not always quantifiable, so you actively seek direct dialogue with our users to capture qualitative insights.


__

Our Techstack:

SQL | Snowflake | Snowplow | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you’re most productive, whether that’s at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, …), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:   Marc Riehle

Title: Data Analyst - Product (d/f/m)
Description:
Our Story

Every year millions of people are either filing their taxes in fear or giving up on their tax refund altogether. We're working on fixing that. Our intuitive app enables anyone, regardless of education or background, to file their taxes with newfound confidence.

Spread across Germany, Spain and the UK, the team at Taxfix Group with its brands Taxfix, Steuerbot and TaxScouts, is a compassionate group of solution-finders. We speak our minds openly, and with over 400 professionals, including tax experts, developers, and IT security experts, we're rich in ideas and voices. The group has facilitated more than 3.5 billion euros in tax refunds for its customers since its founding in 2016

Your Challenge

As a Data Analyst in our Product Analytics team, you will play a key role in shaping data-informed decision-making across multiple mission teams.

Partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and other cross-functional stakeholders, you will use data to uncover insights about user behavior across both our customer-facing products and internal tools.

Your work will involve designing and building reports, analyzing feature performance, generating actionable insights that drive product improvements, and contributing to a robust data foundation by helping define and structure the right tracking and data capture.

Your Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior and product usage to uncover trends, pain points, and opportunities.
Define and track key product metrics to measure feature performance and business impact.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives and share insights with a range of stakeholders.
Build dashboards to enable self-serve analytics across the organization, and also up-skill your stakeholders.
Collaborate with the Analytics Engineering to improve our data sources and self-serve solution.


Your Profile


2+ years of experience in a data analytics role, ideally within a product or tech environment
Ability to translate complex data into clear insights and actionable recommendations.
Good communication skills and ability to work with stakeholders across all levels.
Excellent SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Mixpanel, Tableau).
Keen interest in AI’s potential, paired with hands-on experimentation and solid conceptual understanding of generative-AI tools.


Nice To Have


Experience with A/B testing and Python are plus.
Data modelling and dbt knowledge are a plus.


Why Taxfix?


A chance to do meaningful, people-centric work with an international team of passionate professionals.
Holistic well-being with free mental health coaching sessions and yoga.
A monthly allowance to spend on an extensive range of services that you can use and roll over as flexibly as you like.
Employee stock options for all employees—because everyone deserves to benefit from the success they help to create.
30 annual vacation days and flexible working hours.
A generous learning budget to support your personal and professional development and guidance from our internal L&D experts.
Work from abroad for up to six weeks every year. Just align with your team, and then enjoy your trip.
Plenty of opportunities to socialise as a team. In addition to internal tech meetups, our international team hosts regular get-togethers—virtually and in person when possible.
Free tax declaration filing, of course, through the Taxfix app—and internal support for all personal tax-related questions.
Have a four-legged friend in your life? We’re happy to have dogs join us in the office.


Excited? So are we. Learn more about Team Taxfix on our blog and get a glimpse of our culture.

At Taxfix, we believe that incredible things happen when you have a wealth of perspectives and experiences. We're proudly committed to equal employment and development opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, colour, disability, or place of origin. To help mitigate any potential unconscious biases, we ask that you refrain from including your picture, age, or marital status on your CV. Let your experiences speak for themselves.

Not sure if you meet all the requirements for this role? Please apply anyway. You might bring something special to the team that we hadn't considered previously.
