Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Atlas Metrics


Berlin, Germany
Full-time
Hybrid
No Salary Information Available


Posted 34 days ago

Apply for this job

Atlas Metrics is on a mission to provide full transparency in the sustainability impact of companies. The company is developing a leading technology platform that helps organizations track and manage their Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) data. The Data Engineer role is critical in crafting scalable solutions that enhance ESG data management, backed by significant venture capital support.

In this role you can expect to have the responsibilities:


Develop scalable data pipelines for ESG data ingestion, processing, and storage.
Implement ETL/ELT processes for clean data preparation for analytics.
Create and optimize data models and warehouses for benchmarking and risk analysis.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
Conduct basic data analysis using SQL or Python to uncover insights.
Collaborate on integrating ESG metrics into dashboards or visualizations.
Work with stakeholders to align technical solutions with business goals.
Support ROI case studies through data extraction and financial modeling.


This Role Comes With The Following Benefits


Competitive salary
Generous equity package
Bonus scheme
Family-friendly flexible work environment
Nilo.health account
Annual learning and development budget
28 days of vacation, with annual increments
New MacBook and budget for accessories
Urban Sports membership or similar option
Regular team co-locations and offsites


This Role Requires You To Have


3+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role or similar.
Proficient in Python and SQL for data processing and analytics.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
Knowledge of data warehousing with tools like Redshift or Big Query.
Familiarity with cross-functional team collaboration.


You Would Benefit From Having


Experience with ESG, FinTech, Renewable Energy, or Transportation projects.
Understanding of sustainability reporting frameworks like SFDR or PAI.
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Apache Spark or Kafka.
Ability to create visualizations using Looker or Omni.


Atlas Metrics is supported by leading venture capital firms and encourages professional development opportunities. The company values diversity and inclusivity in its dynamic team environment.

Title: AI Officer (w/m/d) Business Administration
Description:
Deutsche Welle

AI Officer (w/m/d) Business Administration

Bonn, Berlin

Kennziffer: 2499

Aufgabe

Du entwickelst maßgeblich die KI-Strategie und -Governance für die Business Administration und verankerst diese nachhaltig in Strukturen, Prozessen und der Unternehmenskultur Du beobachtest kontinuierlich technologische Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich KI, Datenmanagement und Digitalisierung, mit besonderem Fokus auf betriebswirtschaftliche Anwendungen in der Verwaltung Gemeinsam mit den Fachbereichen identifizierst du relevante KI-Anwendungsfelder, priorisierst diese, in Abstimmung mit der Management Director Business Administration und den Fachbereichen, entwickelst Use Cases und begleitest deren Umsetzung - von der Idee bis zur Integration in den Arbeitsalltag Du verantwortest die Weiterentwicklung der Datenarchitektur sowie die Sicherstellung von Datenqualität und -konsistenz und definierst konkrete Anforderungen an das Data Board der DW und bist weisungsbefugt gegenüber den BA-Abteilungen hinsichtlich Datenmanagement-Richtlinien Du leitest eine abteilungsübergreifende KI-Expert*innengruppe innerhalb der Business Administration und arbeitest eng mit KI-Stellen in der gesamten Organisation sowie mit externen Schnittstellen (z. B. anderen Rundfunkanstalten) zusammen Du konzipierst und koordinierst Maßnahmen zum Kompetenzaufbau im Bereich KI für Mitarbeitende der Business Administration und begleitest den kulturellen Wandel hin zu einer datengetriebenen Organisation Du bringst Erfahrung in der Anwendung von KI-Methoden im Kontext von Business Intelligence, Automatisierung und Datenanalyse mit und entwickelst innovative Lösungen zur Effizienzsteigerung Du entwickelst Positionspapiere, Entscheidungsvorlagen und Strategien zu KI und Datenmanagement für die/den Managing Director der Business Administration

Qualifikation

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Data Science, Verwaltungswissenschaften, Betriebswirtschaft oder vergleichbar Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich KI, Datenmanagement oder Digitalisierung - idealerweise im öffentlichen oder mediennahen Umfeld Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von KI-Methoden, insbesondere im betriebswirtschaftlichen Kontext Wirtschaftliches und analytisches Denken und Handeln, hohe Einsatzbereitschaft und Eigeninitiative Begeisterung für Innovation, Veränderung und die Gestaltung zukunftsfähiger Verwaltungsstrukturen Hohe Kommunikationskompetenz Erfahrungen in der Analyse, Dokumentation und Abstimmung von Anforderungen Ausgeprägte Teamplayer-Fähigkeiten sowie diplomatisches Geschick Ausgezeichnete Deutschkenntnisse (mind. Niveau C1) und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse (mind. Niveau B2), weitere Sprachen von Vorteil

Die vollständige Anzeige finden Sie beim Klick auf den Onlinebewerbungs-Button oder unter folgendem Link:

https://jobs.jobware.net/v/0057?jw_result_piid=057437463&jw_chl_seg=NLINKEDIN

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer)
Description:
As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer) to join the Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-10 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalogue for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs


Qualifications


4+ years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for Internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus) and version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

  • 4+ years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for Internet companies
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
  • Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
  • Experience with data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus) and version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
  • Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Unsolicited/General Working Student Application (m/f/d)
Description:
Couldn't find something that interests you? Send us a general Working Student application if you can't find anything suitable at the moment. We'll contact you if we find a role that fits your needs and abilities.

Requirements


You are/you want to be a working student
Healthcare interest or experience
You are friendly and open to deal with an international multicultural environment
Excited and willing to develop yourself


Benefits


Warm-hearted, flexible, and solution-oriented culture with open feedback culture with performance review to accelerate your career goals!
International environment with more than 30 different nationalities!
Work-Life-Balance: Flexible working hours!
Wellness @CX: Wellness Bonus! A Wellness Stipend of 400 € net annual benefit to contribute to your personal health and wellness
Women @CX: Professional and intellectual knowledge exchange with highly talented and ambitious colleagues from all over the world
You will get access to a learning management tool to attend trainings and improve your skills!
Access to the EAP (Employee Assistance Program) - Solution and support advice in regard to: mental and physical health, employment guidance, personal, family, financial and legal issues and questions
We offer you a vibrant workspace! Regular team events included Christmas and summer parties!
Free coffee and drinks with weekly fresh fruit!
Free Corporate Massages!

Title: Data Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
Unsere Features


Bombastisch & bezaubernd: das IT-Team, das gemeinsam mit dir spannende Missionen antreten möchte
Abwechslungsreich & vielversprechend: die Zukunft der Dussmann Group, die wir mit dir gestalten werden
Vertrauensvoll & flexibel: deine Arbeitszeiten
Sehenswert & reizvoll: dein Desksharing-Arbeitsplatz in der Friedrichstraße sowie inklusive 25% Rabatt auf alle deine Einkäufe im Dussmann KulturKaufhaus
Sicher & unbefristet: dein Arbeitsvertrag in einem krisenfesten Konzern
Langfristig & nachhaltig: deine Fort- und Weiterbildungsoptionen z.B. auf unserem Campus in Zeuthen
Grün & gesund: deine vergünstigte Mittagspause in unserem PLANET!BASED-Restaurant im Untergeschoss
Sensationell & amüsant: unsere Mitarbeiterevents wie Stammtisch, After-Work, Sommer- und Weihnachtsfeste, Teamfrühstück etc.
Attraktiv & lukrativ: deine Vergütung


Deine Mission

Du musst kein Superheld sein, um Großes zu bewirken. In der Welt der Daten reicht oft ein klarer Kopf, ein gutes Verständnis für komplexe Zusammenhänge - und ein bisschen Freude am Coden. Wenn du gerne Strukturen schaffst, wo andere nur Daten sehen, und du dich in modernen Cloud-Technologien genauso wohlfühlst wie im Austausch mit Kolleg:innen aus verschiedenen Bereichen, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wir suchen jemanden, der mit technischem Know-how, Teamgeist und einem Blick fürs Wesentliche unsere Datenplattform weiterentwickelt - und dabei vielleicht sogar ein bisschen Spaß hat.


Du baust Datentransformationsstrecken, die nicht nur funktionieren, sondern auch bei Nacht deployt werden können, ohne dass du schweißgebadet aufwachst - mit Tools wie Azure Databricks, Apache Airflow oder Azure Data Factory.
Du unterstützt Führungskräfte, indem du technische Klarheit schaffst - und manchmal auch emotionale Stabilität, wenn das Deployment mal wieder zickt.
Du modellierst Daten, als wären sie Lego-Steine: strukturiert, durchdacht und mit dem gewissen „Klick“.
Du führst Deployments durch, dokumentierst gewissenhaft und sorgst dafür, dass deine Datenqualität nicht nur „okay“, sondern „wow“ ist.
Du bist Ansprechpartner:in für System Owner - also der Mensch, der komplexe Anforderungen in verständliche Lösungen übersetzt (und dabei nicht die Geduld verliert).
Du arbeitest mit dem AI Lab zusammen, wo du dafür sorgst, dass aus fancy Algorithmen auch tatsächlich funktionierende Produkte werden.
Du kooperierst mit BI Engineers, damit Dashboards nicht nur hübsch aussehen, sondern auch die Wahrheit sagen.
Du bringst dich in Projekte ein, diskutierst Datenarchitektur mit Kolleg:innen und hast dabei sogar gelegentlich Spaß.
Du arbeitest mit Fachbereichen und IT, als wärst du ein diplomatischer Datenbotschafter - mit technischem Tiefgang und einem offenen Ohr.


Deine Skills


Du hast ein Studium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Statistik oder etwas ähnlich Nerdigem abgeschlossen - oder dir das Wissen auf anderem Weg draufgeschafft.
Du verstehst Datenmodellierung und Softwarearchitektur - und weißt, dass „Big Data“ nicht nur ein Buzzword ist.
Du kennst dich mit Azure aus (Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake) - oder mit anderen Cloud-Werkzeugen, die mindestens genauso cool sind.
SQL, Python, Spark und GIT sind für dich keine Fremdwörter, sondern deine täglichen Begleiter - fast wie Kaffee.
Du arbeitest selbstständig, sorgfältig und mit einem Auge fürs Detail - auch wenn’s mal stressig wird.
Du kannst zwischen Business, IT und deinem Team vermitteln - und bleibst dabei meistens freundlich.
Dein Englisch ist verhandlungssicher - dein Humor optional, aber willkommen
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Status: 6 month Fixed Term Contract

Reports to: Global Payroll Manager

Works with: Finance Team

Job Purpose

Finance team: The role is to support the payroll team in managing and improving data quality, reconciliation and reporting during a period of high operational demand. The role is essential for ensuring accurate payroll reporting, supporting the rollout of a Global Payroll Provider and preparing for upcoming compliance requirements.




Principal accountabilities

Data Cleansing & Validation

Clean, structure, and validate large payroll data to ensure accuracy and consistency (both for current operations and during the roll out of the Global Payroll provider).
Identify and correct anomalies in payroll and accounting data
Collaborate with Payroll, HR and Finance teams to ensure data alignment, particularly within the HiBob platform.

Reconciliations

Perform regular reconciliations between payroll records and general ledger accounts.
Investigate and resolve discrepancies in payroll transactions and accounting entries.

Budget & Variance Analysis, Reporting

Assist in preparing payroll-related budget forecasts.
Analyse actual payroll costs against budgeted figures and explain variances.
Provide monthly variance reports with actionable insights.
Maintain year-to-date payroll reports and audit packs.
Support audits and compliance checks with accurate data and documentation.
Respond to ad hoc data requests from senior management and external auditors.
Assist in preparing data and reports for the mandatory payrolling of Benefits in Kind (BiKs) starting April 2026.
Process optimisation - Identify inefficiencies in workflows and streamline payroll processes

UAT Testing – Global Payroll Project

Lead testing and reconciliation during parallel runs for the Global Payroll Provider rollout.

Skills And Attributes

Proven experience in data analysis within payroll or finance.
Strong Excel and data manipulation skills; experience with HiBob is a plus.
Familiarity with payroll systems, accounting principles, and compliance requirements.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Ability to work collaboratively across departments.
Experience supporting audits and compliance processes is desirable.
Strong communication and documentation skills.




Essential

Qualifications and experience

Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions (e.g. pivot tables, lookups, data validation).
Experience working with large datasets and performing data cleansing, transformation and validation.
Solid understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and financial reconciliations.
Familiarity with HRIS and payroll systems (e.g. HiBob, Moorepay, Papaya, Justworks or similar platforms).
Demonstrated ability to produce clear, accurate and insightful reports for stakeholders.
Experience supporting audits and compliance reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across departments.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.




Preferred

Experience working within a global or multi-country payroll environment.
Experience participating in system implementations or UAT testing phases.
Ability to document processes and create user-friendly guides




Application Closing Date: 22nd August 2025

Please note that while we have a closing date for this application, we reserve the right to interview candidates and potentially close the role early should we find a suitable candidate before the closing date.




Help shape the future of reporting for global financial markets

The IFRS Foundation is a public interest, not-for profit organisation that sets corporate reporting standards for the capital markets globally. IFRS Accounting Standards are required for use by more than 140 countries whilst IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards are rapidly becoming the global baseline for sustainability disclosures worldwide.

We are a highly diverse and inclusive organisation. Our 350+ staff come from more than 45+ different countries and are united in supporting the mission of the Foundation to bring transparency, accountability and efficiency to capital markets worldwide. With offices in London, Frankfurt, Montreal, Tokyo, Beijing and San Francisco, the Foundation is truly a global standard-setter.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you’ll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You’ll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima’s data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2–3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You’ll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

🤸Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you’re a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI

Data Analyst - Excel, Power BI




The location of the role is Paddington, London (hybrid working).

The duration of the contract is 8 months.

The pay rate on offer is £300 - £350 per day (via Umbrella agency).




The client is a multinational high-street retailer.

Business area: Food Packaging




Key accountabilities and measures

Provide analytical support and reports based on data research and analysis to the Compliance Team to drive data consistency and accuracy
Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
Ongoing training to confidently work with the business’ systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.




Key skills and experience

Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Show more

  • Resolve commercial and technical queries for all stakeholders and provide appropriate commentary to ensure clarity on root cause and avoid any reoccurrence
  • Deliver efficient analytical reports and insights through data research and analysis to support the Compliance Team in driving data submissions accuracy
  • Effective co-ordination of data gathering processes to ensure alignment with external and internal reporting requirements
  • Collate and maintain data reports within agreed standards
  • Liaise internally and externally with departments, suppliers, and compliance agencies
  • Ensure timely transfer of raw sales data and packaging information from different business areas
  • Assist compliance team with data verification for reporting and ensuring data declarations completed and submitted to schedule
  • Monitor and audit data quality and report any issues to key stakeholders
  • Identify problems and recommend solutions to improve the processes and ways or working.
  • Ongoing training to confidently work with the business’ systems GMOR, SAP, PLM, FIND, Business objects, etc.
  • Resolve administrative problems and inquiries with reporting from the compliance agencies
  • Prepare written responses to routine enquiries
  • Raise any system issue logs with Tech support and ensure resolution the completion
  • Raise Purchase Orders and maintain the Compliance Invoicing tracker for the function.


Key skills and experience

  • Excellent knowledge and practical skills of Excel (PivotTables, VLOOKUP) and other Microsoft Office programs - Power BI
  • Ability to simultaneously manage, prioritise and deliver multiple projects/priorities on time
  • Strong delivery focus with great attention to detail, routine process, and completion of tasks.
  • Commitment to continuous improvement of digital and data skills
  • Confident and professional verbal and written communication skills
  • Takes initiative and comfortable working autonomously
  • Ability to initiate and build strong relationships with own team, across functions and channels

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Migration Analyst, UK (6-month Fixed Term Contract)

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Migration Analyst to join our ApotheCom team on a 6-month fixed term contract basis.

ApotheCom is an exciting leader in the field of medical communications. Drawn together from several backgrounds including the pharmaceutical industry, research, marketing, medical and regulatory writing, sales, publishing, digital media and design, we have the experience and all-round ability to conceive and deliver the best quality medical communications programmes.

About The Role

Reporting to the Finance Director, the Data Migration Analyst supports the seamless and accurate migration of data from Deltek Maconomy into Oracle ERP systems. This role requires a strong understanding of financial data structures, experience in ERP systems (ideally in Maconomy and Oracle), and a methodical approach to data extraction, transformation, validation, and loading (ETL). The Data Migration Analyst will play a crucial role in ensuring data integrity, consistency, and minimal business disruption during the transition.

Key responsibilities will include:


Leading and executing data migration activities from Maconomy to Oracle Fusion.
Collaborating with functional and technical teams to define data migration strategy, scope, and timelines.
Extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from Maconomy, ensuring alignment with Oracle data structures.
Collaborating with key stakeholders to cleanse, map, and validate data to meet Oracle standards and project requirements.
Developing and maintaining detailed documentation of data migration processes, mapping logic, and validation scripts.
Conducting data quality checks, performing reconciliation between systems, and resolving discrepancies.
Working with stakeholders to identify legacy data to be migrated and defining data retention policies.
Supporting testing cycles (System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing) with relevant data sets.
Ensuring compliance with data governance, security, and privacy policies.
Providing regular updates and status reports to the project team and senior stakeholders.


About you:

To succeed in this role, you will have:


Proven experience with data migration projects in a similar role. Experience with data migration from Maconomy to Oracle ERP is desirable, but not essential. .
Strong understanding of ERP data models, especially in finance, projects, HR, and procurement modules.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a deadline-driven environment.


Don't meet every job requirement? That's okay! Our company is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you're excited about this role, but your experience doesn't perfectly fit every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this role or others.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst (Power BI / SQL)

Location: London (Hybrid – 2 days onsite)

Salary: £45,000 + Benefits

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent




Are you a data-driven thinker using Power BI and SQL?

Looking for a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact while continuing to grow your skills?




We’re hiring a Data Analyst to join a growing team within a dynamic and forward-thinking Insurance services company with a global footprint. Reporting directly to the Group Data Lead, you’ll play a hands-on role in developing high-quality dashboards, reporting tools, and data solutions used by internal stakeholders and external clients.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Build and maintain Power BI dashboards, including externally-facing reports for clients and underwriting teams
Write SQL queries to extract, transform and support backend reporting
Collaborate with internal teams to gather requirements and translate them into insightful visualisations
Develop KPI dashboards and static reports (Excel, PowerPoint) for strategic insights
Support client rollouts and help onboard data-driven solutions




Tech Stack & Tools:

Power BI (including Paginated Reports)
SQL
Excel & PowerPoint
Familiarity with Microsoft Fabric is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

1 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Reporting Analyst role
Solid experience with Power BI and confident using SQL
Strong communication skills – able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
A proactive, delivery-focused mindset – someone who takes ownership of tasks
Keen to learn and develop in a non-hierarchical, supportive environment
Comfortable working with small to mid-sized datasets (this is not a big data role)




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salary (up to £45K)
Hybrid working – 2 days per week in a central London office
A supportive team with mentorship from senior data professionals
Exposure to global teams across Europe, the US, and Asia
An inclusive, values-led culture with strong ethical foundations




If you're excited about leveraging your Power BI and SQL skills in a meaningful way and want to be part of a forward-thinking, global environment — apply today!

Title: Insights Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Business Insights Analyst

Role Type: Temporary – 6 Months – Full Time

Location: London – St. Pancras – x3 Days On-Site per week / x2 days Working Remote







Your New Company




As a Business Insights Analyst you will be working within the UK Oncology Insights and Analytics team to provide relevant insights and analysis to enable an optimal diagnosis of our business performance.




In this regard, the Business Insights Analyst will be responsible for analysing different data sources (sales data, competitive insights, activity, etc.) to generate insights aimed at delivering competitive advantage. In addition, the incumbent will also contribute to critical business processes connected to data automation, brand planning and financial planning.







Your New Role




Generate insights on patients, customers and NHS as well as brands, markets and TA by analysing multiple data sources to inform and influence business decisions
Deliver performance analytics on priority brands by (1) identifying patterns within the data, (2) uncovering insights / brand opportunities and (3) articulate useful recommendations
Support strategic planning and financial planning processes
Support data and analytics automation processes
Working closely with the BUs, develop a thorough understanding of current key business issues and provide solutions to support BU decision making
Proactively identifies blind spots and opportunities in terms of unanswered business questions and insights
Drive compliant processes according to AZ SoPs and Code of conduct




Essential Skills




3 to 5 years of experience in analytical or insights generation roles
Analytical skills, strong excel + power point skills
Knowledge of NHS and the pharma industry – Oncology advantageous
Ability to distil impactful insights out of different data
Proven track record of working with senior stakeholders in a complex environment
Self-starter who can face challenges with positive attitude




Desirable Skills




Oncology knowledge / experience
Experience with PowerBI
Pharma Sales & Marketing experience







WHY ASTRAZENECA?




It's an exciting time to join AstraZeneca, a global business that's rapidly growing - there's a lot happening and even more to come. And we are a valued part of this journey. Respected partners across the business, we provide the platform that's going to power us to achieve more.




So, what's next?




Are you ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it's yours. Please apply with a copy of your CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Data Migration to Workday HCM / Freelance (Inside IR35)




You’ll be working closely with our colleagues across the ERP Transformation Team alongside our Finance, IT, Data & Tech teams and other broader functions to support our global employee data collection, reporting and updating. We are undergoing a large transformation across our People function and the ERP Transformation team has a vast array of projects with touchpoints across multiple projects. We need a data analyst to help us deliver accurate and timely global employee data reports whenever and however needed.




We are building a holistic, sustainable and scalable People Operating Model enabled by Workday HCM and other technology solutions, alongside new ways of working in our service delivery model, including payroll harmonization.




What you'll do




Reporting into the People Transformation Data Lead, you will:




· Become the company's subject matter expert in all things related to global employee data with curiosity and a willingness to dive into the details to understand the data, it sources and definitions.

· Filter and “clean” data by reviewing validation reports.

· Update data within various source systems, which will require an understanding of our data lineage.

· Identify opportunities to establish and/or improve operational processes to update and maintain our data, improving quality and implementing scalable solutions for our employee data lifecycle.

· Document end to end data entry, update, and reporting processes.

· Assist with communications notifying stakeholders of new/improved processes.

· Responsible for stakeholder issue resolution.

· Assist with future upgrades and system enhancements which may include new software.

· Interpret stakeholder data reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports.

· Scope out and support projects related to our data that span functions.

· Implement metrics and timelines with any data project required.

· Manage multiple data-related projects at one time, identifying and raising risks, dependencies, and prioritization concerns.




What you'll need:




· Analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills

· HCM / People Data Experience; Workday HCM a plus

· Workday Enterprise Interface Builder experience

· Experience of Data visualization tools

· Willingness to learn new tools and systems

· Ability to effectively communicate across a global community which requires an openness to diversity of thought, backgrounds and cultures

· Technology experience or interest

· Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills

· Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company leadership

· Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated

· General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on




Start date: 4th August

Duration: 12 month contract

Location: London (some days on-site required)

Rate: £550-575 per day ** INSIDE IR35 **

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k–£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you’ll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm’s investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data & Insights Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid)

Type: Full-time

Salary: £55,000–£65,000 (DOE)




About the Company

We’re working with a London-based luxury fashion brand that’s integrating data at the core of their operations. As the business scales, they’re developing a bespoke ERP platform to drive better decision-making across production, inventory, and sales.




The Opportunity

This is a great opportunity for a skilled Data & Insights Analyst to join a growing team and help shape how data is used across the business. You’ll be responsible for designing pipelines, building dashboards, and delivering insight to support product and operational excellence.




Key Responsibilities

Build and maintain ETL processes using Python and Power Query M
Create clear, insightful dashboards in Power BI using DAX
Work closely with engineering and product teams to embed analytics into the ERP platform
Analyse large datasets to support operational efficiency and continuous improvement
Contribute to forecasting and inventory optimisation initiatives
Present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help establish and maintain best practices in data governance




What We’re Looking For

A STEM degree from a Russell Group university or equivalent
At least 2 years’ experience using Python for data analysis
Advanced Power BI skills, including DAX and Power Query M
Solid SQL experience and comfort working with relational databases
Strong analytical and communication skills
Experience working with product teams to implement data-driven solutions
Familiarity with forecasting or inventory planning is a plus




Why Apply?

Play a key role in shaping a data-first approach at a high-end fashion brand
Work in a hybrid environment with flexibility and autonomy
Competitive salary in a growing, innovation-focused business

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
MI Analyst - Speciality Insurance - London - Hybrid - Reinsurance - £60,000




We are seeking a skilled MI Analyst to join a dynamic team where you will play a crucial role in delivering management information and business intelligence solutions. The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to understand reporting and data requirements, transforming these into insightful, accurate, and timely MI reports and dashboards.




This role requires expertise in Power BI, SQL, and DAX to develop, maintain, and optimise reporting solutions that support decision-making across insurance and reinsurance functions. You will be responsible for data analysis, report creation, and ensuring data integrity while collaborating with technical teams to enhance data platforms and reporting capabilities. A strong understanding of the insurance industry, particularly insurance and reinsurance processes, is essential to effectively translate business needs into actionable insights.




Required Skills:




Strong and proven proficiency in Power BI, SQL and DAX
Data analysis and reporting
Management Information (MI) development
Insurance and reinsurance domain knowledge
Data visualisation best practices
Stakeholder engagement and communication




This is a fantastic opportunity for anyone looking to take their next step in their career in Speciality Insurance with a reputable organisation.

HTML:
MI Analyst - Speciality Insurance - London - Hybrid - Reinsurance - £60,000


We are seeking a skilled MI Analyst to join a dynamic team where you will play a crucial role in delivering management information and business intelligence solutions. The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to understand reporting and data requirements, transforming these into insightful, accurate, and timely MI reports and dashboards.


This role requires expertise in Power BI, SQL, and DAX to develop, maintain, and optimise reporting solutions that support decision-making across insurance and reinsurance functions. You will be responsible for data analysis, report creation, and ensuring data integrity while collaborating with technical teams to enhance data platforms and reporting capabilities. A strong understanding of the insurance industry, particularly insurance and reinsurance processes, is essential to effectively translate business needs into actionable insights.


Required Skills:


  • Strong and proven proficiency in Power BI, SQL and DAX
  • Data analysis and reporting
  • Management Information (MI) development
  • Insurance and reinsurance domain knowledge
  • Data visualisation best practices
  • Stakeholder engagement and communication


This is a fantastic opportunity for anyone looking to take their next step in their career in Speciality Insurance with a reputable organisation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Kato, speed is our superpower.




We’re a fast-growing PropTech startup on a mission to completely transform the commercial property industry. Backed by top-tier VCs, industry experts, and a leadership team with deep real estate and technology expertise, our all-in-one platform and rich industry data are already trusted by 80% of the UK commercial real estate market.




We’re building new product lines, unlocking untapped market segments, and scaling internationally and we’re doing it with a small, focused team that moves fast, thinks big, and communicates openly.




We need a Data Analyst who thrives in high-growth, high-energy environments. Someone who can work end-to-end from scoping questions with stakeholders, to digging into complex datasets, to delivering insights that directly influence decisions across the company.




If you’ve got startup or scaling experience, know how to balance speed with quality, and can explain complex findings in a way that makes everyone (from engineers to execs) sit up and listen … this is your opportunity to make a massive impact.




Why This Role Exists:




At Kato, data isn’t just a byproduct of what we do - it drives every decision we make.




Whether it’s helping sales prioritise the hottest leads, guiding product to build features our customers will love, or giving leadership the visibility they need to set strategy - data is at the heart of it! This is not a “sit in the corner and build reports” role. You’ll be:




Embedded in conversations with decision-makers.
Helping shape the company’s direction at a strategic level.
Ensuring data is clean, reliable, and accessible so that every team can move faster.




Whats on Offer:




Competitive salary
Private healthcare including dental & optical
25 days holiday + your birthday off + duvet days
Hybrid working - 2 -3 days in-office (Carnaby Street), 2 days WFH
Snacks, drinks & team lunches in our Soho office
The opportunity to help build one of PropTech’s most data-rich platforms from the ground up




What You’ll Be Doing:




Data Analysis & Insights




Analyse complex, multi-source datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Deliver clear, actionable insights to support fast, informed decisions.
Maintain and improve reports and dashboards to track company-wide KPIs.
Run ad-hoc deep dives to answer urgent business questions.
Contribute to forecasting models, scenario evaluations, and strategic planning.




Business Intelligence & Reporting




Build and manage dashboards in Amazon Quicksight, Tableau, or Power BI.
Define and standardise KPIs in collaboration with stakeholders.Present findings in clear, jargon-free language for both technical and non-technical audiences.




Data Preparation & Transformation




Clean and transform data from multiple sources for consistency and accuracy.
Work closely with analytics and data engineers to improve accessibility and quality.
Maintain curated datasets for recurring reports and business-critical analyses.




Data Quality & Governance




Validate and QA data to ensure 100% trust in the numbers.
Document analytical processes, data definitions, and calculation logic.
Support initiatives that improve metric consistency and governance across teams.




Stakeholder Collaboration




Partner with every function such as Product, Marketing, Ops, Finance, to gather requirements and deliver data-driven insights.
Translate business needs into analytical approaches and clear, confident recommendations.Manage projects end-to-end, from scoping through to delivering outputs that land with impact.




What We’re Looking For:




Must-Haves:




Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and transforming data, plus advanced Excel skills.
Hands-on experience with BI/visualisation tools (Quicksight, Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Comfort working with large, complex datasets from multiple sources.
Strong analytical skills, a problem-solving mindset, and a laser focus on detail.
Ability to communicate complex data stories to diverse audiences - from engineers to execs.
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver measurable business impact.




Nice-to-Haves:




Python or R for deeper analysis.
Familiarity with dbt and modern data warehouses (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, Databricks).
Experience in statistical analysis, experimentation, or A/B testing.
Exposure to data governance best practices and documentation.




What Success Looks Like:




Teams across Kato are making faster, better decisions thanks to your insights.
Dashboards and reports are trusted, up-to-date, and directly support business goals.
Stakeholders describe you as a partner, not just a data person.
You’re known for clear communication and the ability to simplify complexity without losing depth.




Interview Process & Timings:




We move quickly - you’ll always know where you stand so here are the stages of the interview process:




Introductory Call with Technical Recruiter - 20 mins A friendly chat to learn more about you, your background, and career goals, while giving you an overview of Kato and the role.
Take-Home Task - 3 hours A realistic dataset and brief to showcase your data cleaning, analysis, and insight-generation skills.
Technical Discussion with Head of Engineering - 90 mins - We will review of your take-home task and have a discussion of your technical skills, problem-solving approach, and collaboration style as well an opportunity for you to ask questions about our engineering culture and data strategy.
On-site Conversation with Founder - 30 mins - Meet at our Carnaby Street HQ to connect with our Founder, discuss our vision, and explore how you can shape our future.
Offer - If we’re aligned, we won’t hang around - we’ll get you an offer fast!




Why Join us at Kato?




Impact from day one - your work will be live and influencing decisions within days, not months.
Small, high-calibre team - work alongside talented people who care deeply about the mission.
Direct access to leadership - you’ll be in the room for important conversations, not on the sidelines.
Growth opportunities - as we scale, you’ll have the chance to take on more responsibility and shape your role.




If you’re the kind of analyst who gets energy from solving problems, thrives under pace, and knows how to make numbers tell a story we’d love to hear from you.

  1. Introductory Call with Technical Recruiter - 20 mins A friendly chat to learn more about you, your background, and career goals, while giving you an overview of Kato and the role.

  • Small, high-calibre team - work alongside talented people who care deeply about the mission.
  • Direct access to leadership - you’ll be in the room for important conversations, not on the sidelines.
  • Growth opportunities - as we scale, you’ll have the chance to take on more responsibility and shape your role.


If you’re the kind of analyst who gets energy from solving problems, thrives under pace, and knows how to make numbers tell a story we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data & Information

Location: Greenford (UB6 0HE) or Bow Road (E3 2SE) Campus - (On-site)

Type of Contract: Permanent

GBS is a higher education provider offering a range of sector-relevant courses across ten campuses in London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Working in partnership with several of the UK’s leading higher education providers, we deliver vocational, undergraduate and postgraduate programmes in finance, accounting, business, construction, tourism, healthcare, and more.

Our Vision: Changing lives through education.

What We Do: Developing and writing quality reports both internally for GBS and for GBS partner organisations and other external agencies. To contribute to preparations for degree awarding powers.

The role: Working with internal stakeholders, you will use your expertise to gather existing and/or new data (where identified) and undertake analysis to provide data insights across GBS. Applying appropriate analytical techniques, you will present your findings appropriately through written reports or through intuitive, self-serve dashboards that will empower colleagues to understand the key metrics that drive performance throughout the organisation.

Please note, we are unable to offer sponsorship for this position.

Main Responsibilities

What the role involves:


Work within a team to manage new data projects from end-to-end, gathering requirements through to developing and implementing new reports.
Engage with stakeholders to validate their requirements, review policies/procedures and present solution options in a manner that can be evaluated to meet needs.
Extract, prepare and collate raw data from multiple sources and provide analysing and manipulating data to produce customised reports and insights.
Lead and/or work within a team to design and implement surveys across the organisation, analysis of survey outcomes.
Analyse and interpret data to assist in providing solutions to deliver improved service delivery/performance and an optimal student experience.
Recognise erroneous data and escalate to the appropriate individual, in line with company procedures.
Monitor and assist in audits for data quality, data integrity and data governance.
Prepare reports for internal and external audiences using appropriate reporting tools, including Excel and Power BI.
Provide sector benchmarking through analysis of outcomes of NSS, TEF and Graduate Outcome Surveys.



Requirements

What Experience/Skills are required:


A good degree in a numerate subject
Prior use and understanding of Power BI or Tableau is essential.
Previous experience with data analysis.
Detailed knowledge of statistical techniques and research methodologies.
Experience in presenting data and providing insights via interactive dashboards or presentations.
Experience with R/Python/SPSS or SQL.
Confidence in building relations with internal and external stakeholders, with the ability to communicate complex data capability in a simple way.
Excellent knowledge of analytical tools, including Microsoft Power BI.
A good understanding of data and model design.



Desirable Experience:


Work experience in Higher Education or Public Sector.



Other Information

What We Offer


25 days annual leave, plus 8 public holidays
1-day extra leave per year of service, up to a maximum of 5 days
Workplace pension scheme
Tuition reimbursement for career development courses
Flexible Benefits: Cycle to Work, Workplace Nursery, Techscheme and much more
Perks@Work discounts platform, wellbeing centre and much more
Reward and recognition programme
£500 award employee referral scheme
Discretionary annual performance bonus



“GBS has been a good place for professional growth. I have received great support from managers and colleagues who have encouraged me to develop new skills and take on more senior roles. Their mentorship has been invaluable to help me advance in my career.”

— Barbara Vargas (Professional Services Employee)

GBS is committed to equality, diversity and inclusion and providing a workplace free from discrimination or harassment. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and communities. We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where everyone feels welcomed.

#indeedjune

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations
Description:
OVERVIEW

Company description

Publicis Groupe is one of the world’s largest communications holding companies, present in over 110 countries and employing about 100,000 professionals.. The Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing transformation and digital business transformation.

HELPING OUR CLIENTS UNLOCK GROWTH IN THE PLATFORM WORLD

Our clients compete in the platform world, a horizontal marketplace between creators and consumers, between speakers and listeners, between buyers and sellers. To thrive in the platform world, companies must continue to innovate their products and business models. Four imperatives (1. Real Identity, 2. Dynamic, Diverse and Disruptive Creativity 3., Smart Media and 4. Direct Relationships) via our suite of world-class agencies, are necessary for modern brands to win in the platform world. At Publicis Groupe, we’ve invested in capabilities across these four imperatives our clients need to unlock growth. As the only one who can architect, build and orchestrate end to end solutions, not only do we have a proven record of building bespoke models for clients and leading expertise across all major industry categories, we are able to offer our talents more opportunities to grow and benefit from a richer learning experience. We call this Power of One. Powered by a 100,000-strong network via Marcel, our AI-based platform, we are also able to provide our clients and talents instant access to resource, knowledge for any need, any time, in any market.

THE SPIRIT OF VIVA LA DIFFERENCE

Viva La Difference is deeply rooted in everything we do. It has always been in our DNA. From the birth of Publicis, 94 years ago, when Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, our founder, invented French advertising. Viva La Difference expresses how we value and respect each individual and recognize what makes us distinctive. This is the charge that inspires our teams to celebrate the differences in identity, background, culture, and experience of all of us. It is how we behave with each other and our clients, and it is deeply rooted throughout our work, to elevate and bring to life our differences throughout the platform world.

Overview

At Publicis Groupe, we believe in the power of data to transform how brands connect with people. Our Data Solutions team leads a Groupe-wide initiative focused on delivering best-in-class reporting and data solutions for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We work hand-in-hand with client teams, analysts, and tech specialists to build scalable, intelligent reporting frameworks that drive insight and action.

We’re now looking for a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations to join our growing team and help bridge the gap between business and tech. If you thrive at the intersection of analytics, systems thinking, and client service—this role is for you.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations, you’ll serve as the strategic link between client-facing teams and our technical developers—translating complex requirements into clear, deliverable solutions. Your focus will span data integrations, API connectors, reporting development, and dashboard functionality. Expect to lead projects end-to-end, working across teams to deliver smart, scalable, and elegant data solutions.

Client & Stakeholder Leadership


Be a trusted partner to internal client teams, ensuring expectations are met with clear timelines, technical support, and transparent communication
Lead regular check-ins to align on goals, capture feedback, and proactively surface new needs
Maintain a detailed understanding of project status and ensure best-in-class service delivery


Data Integration & Testing


Own the setup and maintenance of API connectors and automated reporting pipelines
Validate data quality, perform regression testing, and ensure KPI definitions match client narratives
Collaborate with technical teams to guarantee dashboard integrity and address any discrepancies


Reporting & Dashboard Development


Create dashboard wireframes, gather input from client teams, and translate into development-ready briefs
Oversee QA processes with Data Governance and the BI team
Coordinate testing, troubleshooting, and resolution of reporting issues
Safely manage data sharing with non-Publicis users in line with security standards


Qualifications

✔ Experience in a data, operations, or analytics-focused role

✔ Familiarity with BI and reporting platforms such as Power BI, Datorama, Data Studio, Databricks, SQL

✔ Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

✔ An organised, proactive approach—comfortable working across teams and timelines

✔ Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

✔ A team player who’s passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively

Benefits:

Additional information

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:


WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.


Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.

Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG’s (Employee Action Groups).

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:

  • WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
  • REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
  • HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Halian | Managed Services, Recruitment Agency & Contract Staffing
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with a good understanding in data modeling / data warehouse development, and business intelligence tooling to join my clients payments team, within the fintech space. This role is pivotal in building and optimizing data systems and pipelines that support analytics, reporting.




Key Responsibilities

Develop high-quality Power BI and Tableau dashboards, supporting business teams in making data-informed decisions.
Ensure data integrity, reliability, and performance through testing, monitoring, and documentation.
Exposure to Data Modelling and Warehousing would beneficial as you will need to build data models or migrate existing ones.
Drive best practices in data governance, metadata management, and data security.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data platform and tooling.




Required Skills & Experience

3–5 + years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a FinTech or Payments environment.
Exposure and a good understansinf in data modeling (dimensional and normalized), ETL/ELT design, and data warehousing techniques.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with scripting languages such as Python or Scala.
Demonstrated ability to create impactful dashboards using Power BI and Tableau.
Deep understanding of data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, dbt, Azure Data Factory).
Experience working in agile, cross-functional teams, collaborating closely with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and an ability to balance short-term fixes with long-term scalable solutions.




Nice to Have

Experience with real-time or streaming data (Kafka, Kinesis).
Familiarity with financial transaction data or payment processing systems.
Exposure to data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, PCI-DSS) and data security best practices




This role offers a 2 stage interview process and is required to work on site 3 days a week in central London.




Apply now to be considered!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, 6 months, London/Hybrid, £500+/day (Outside IR35)




My client, a leader in the hospitality industry, are currently looking to bring on a Data Engineer or Data Analyst on a 6 month initial contract.




Position Overview

We are seeking a Data Engineer / Data Analyst / Analytics consultant to join the Service Desk team on a contract basis. This role will be instrumental in analysing the current IT service request landscape, developing a structured service catalogue, and implementing improvements through runbooks and automation. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills and experience with data classification, Zendesk or ServiceNow.




Key Responsibilities




Service Request Analysis & Categorisation

Discover patterns in data by analysing existing service/support requests across multiple channels and systems
Turn raw data into relevant insights by developing and implementing a comprehensive categorisation system
Extract and analyse data from Zendesk/ServiceNow and other systems to identify patterns, frequencies, and resolution times
Create compelling data visualisations and reporting using tools like Excel or Looker to highlight key metrics and trends




Service Catalogue Development

Design and implement a comprehensive IT service catalogue for the organisation
Assess and assign business criticality and priority levels to different service types
Create and maintain good documentation around our data and processes to document requirements, data models, data classifications, and solutions




Please apply for more information

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Ipsos Jarmany was founded in 2008 and is one of the UK’s fastest-growing data consultancy businesses, specialising in data visualisation. Our mission is to build a world-class organisation that helps businesses transform the way they manage and utilise data.

We provide a range of data services, including data strategy, platforms, visualisation and data science, to help our clients uncover the true story their data is telling them and enable them to make data-informed decisions to drive growth and business impact.

Our growing team of data analysts are at the cutting-edge of technology, using advanced analytics tools like Power BI, Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure. We believe in empowering our people so they can become more confident, thrive and fulfil their potential, of course whilst having fun and learning new skills!

And, we’re on the hunt for new and ambitious talent… fancy joining us?

About The Role

As a Graduate Data Analyst, you’ll be working on major projects for globally recognised organisations. You will take on real-world problems for global clients, blending data analytics with strategic acumen from day one, whilst receiving continuous support and training to aid in your development.

At Ipsos Data Labs we place huge emphasis on the collection and structuring of information and utilise a variety of technologies to assist with the ETL process. You’ll be responsible for designing and managing these automated systems and processes while helping to implement best practice throughout the organisation.

You’ll have the opportunity to challenge yourself to fully utilise your capabilities, supporting our commercial teams in developing methods to present and explain complex analysis in a straight-forward, easy to understand way.

As part of this role, you will be enrolled in our graduate scheme which will support you through the first 18 months of your time at Ipsos Data Labs. The scheme will provide you with a structured programme, continuous mentorship, training and hands-on assignments to propel your understanding of data’s impact in the business landscape.

What we look for


A combination of technical capability and commercial acumen
Strong analytical skills combined with excellent communication and presentation skills needed to convey the analysis and insights to clients
Self-motivated individuals who thrive independently and, in a team, setting
Ambitious and driven individuals who want to be future leaders, take on responsibility and hold themselves accountable
Individuals who can apply technical insights derived from data to strategic thinking enabling businesses to achieve their desired objectives


Qualifications & Experience


Minimum 2:1 bachelor’s degree in a STEM subject
Ideally, an A Level in Math or Economics (Grade A / 7 or above preferable)
Programming experience is preferred but not essential


Skills you'll develop


Advanced Excel, Python and SQL Skills
Front-End Data Visualisation Development
Data-driven Commercial Storytelling
Marketing ROI and Digital Analytics Skills
Advanced Presentation Skills


A Typical Day...

Required

The role of our Data Analysts varies depending on the client and project they’ve been assigned to, but typically you’ll be required to:


Engage with extensive data sets using advanced data mining and predictive analytics techniques to uncover and communicate insights.
Design and optimise data processing systems to support data-driven decision-making processes.
Develop compelling data visualisations and dashboards that translate complex analyses into actionable strategies.
Foster collaborative relationships across teams to innovate and enhance commercial solutions.


Diversity and Inclusion

As an equal opportunities' employer, Ipsos Jarmany is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Ipsos Jarmany. We are also “Disability Confident Committed” to ensure we offer a recruitment process and working environment that is accessible to all candidates. Please let us know as soon as possible if you need any additional support so that we can make appropriate adjustments during the recruitment process.
