Title: Analyst, Data Science and Analytics Solutions
Description:
Why You’ll Love Working Here


high-performance, people-focused culture
our commitment that equity, diversity, and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves
learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth
membership in HOOPP’s world class defined benefit pension plan, which can serve as an important part of your retirement security
competitive, 100% company-paid extended health and dental benefits for permanent employees, including coverage supporting our team's diversity and mental health (e.g., gender affirmation, fertility and drug treatment, psychological support benefits of $2,500 per year, parental leave top-up, and a health spending account).
optional post-retirement health and dental benefits subsidized at 50%
yoga classes, meditation workshops, nutritional consultations, and wellness seminars
the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers


Job Summary

The Plan Operations Analytics Group at HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan) is looking for an experienced individual to fill a permanent, full-time Data Scientist role for the Analytics Team. The team delivers insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise in data warehouse knowledge.

The team’s principles are focused on delivering true stakeholder value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. They value challenging the status quo, innovative solutions, team collaboration and practicality.

What You Will Do


Provides strategic Analytics such as forecasts, projections and high-level overview as well as operational (e.g. processing or phone statistics) reporting to management
Provides daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, annual or ad hoc reporting as required by utilizing standard reports or builds. Extracts data from sources such as data warehouse, as well as converts operation-specific data into reports.
Undertake broad subject matter expertise in data and perform an in-depth analysis of data to gather insights and communicate results.
Provides analytics support and data solutions to all areas of HOOPP as required by analysis and communication, acting on requests for data and reporting information. Provides guidance on the structure of databases, drafting of queries, compiling of CRM operational type Analytics to all departments.
Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, etc. Excellence in at least one of these is highly desirable
Provides statistical analysis and interpretation in clear user language on data information and provides written summary reporting as well as communication on that analysis. Ability to synthesize large datasets into clear actionable decision-making for presentation to Management.
Participates in the integration of multiple data sources (data warehouse, portals, dashboards, reports, systems) into specific solutions to answer reporting needs using all relevant data. This is to meet HOOPP’s immediate and future information needs in collaboration with IT.
Creates, develops and maintains Analytics platforms.


What You Bring

Analytical


Understands the why (curious, asks probing questions, digs deep, open-minded)
Ability to create clarity and get everyone on the same page
Excellent Requirements documentation (clear, concise)
Has strong trust and confidence in team and business.


Teamwork


Strong 1:1 working experience with Analysts, business leaders, stakeholders and management.
Provides honest, constructive feedback in an empathetic manner
Identifying and engaging in difficult conversations; Ability to table conflict or team tensions
Ability to improve Team Norms/processes by influencing


Additional Skills And Abilities


Able and comfortable in working with all levels of management to understand, and when needed negotiate, requirements and priorities
Solid communication skills to interact across organizations and offer insights to the business.
Knowledge of Excel, R, Python and MS SQL Server; familiarity with Analytics tools specifically Power BI
Knowledge of relational database structures and applications.
Competency in agile software development

Title: Data Analyst / Modeler Advisory
Description:
Requisition ID: 224783

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Team

CB Data Services manages the collective data asset for the Canadian Bank. DS team members help design and implement the most appropriate data storage, data movement and data integration solutions to meet immediate project requirements while supporting the long term direction of the enterprise. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst & Data Modeler to join our dynamic team focused on the development of enterprise data models and data provisioning to target data platforms. Data analysis and architecture skills are needed to design the use and flow of data between systems; through service calls, data federation, replication, data access, evaluation of performance to align with the appropriate technology and infrastructure to ensure solution optimizes technical and business requirements.

Is this role right for you?


Work with business users to obtain data requirements and analyze source systems data.
Design and develop conceptual, logical and physical data models for the operational and analytical data models
Work closely with the technical and application architects, and developers to implement the data architecture and application solution
Communicate physical database designs to, and work with, database administrator to implement databases
Analysis of source systems data (structured and un-structured) and business requirements
Document data flows, identify appropriate data sources, entities, relationships and redundancies.
Manage data integrity and data quality.
Maintain technical & business metadata. Generate metadata for Hadoop ingestion for different ingestion frameworks.
Design data structures and document data meanings, definitions and intended use, work with various departments/leaders and data stewards to make the “metadata” available.
Define and document the data architecture for operational databases, reporting and provisioning platforms, including the physical components and their functionality
Support data strategies, standards, guidelines data quality process and governance across the enterprise
Provide leadership in researching and architecting emerging technology solutions to meet business strategies and objectives.


Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?


10+ year experience in Data Management, data analysis, modeling, architecture and governance.
Strong Relational and dimensional data modeling and database design, Erwin (Data modeling) skills.
Strong SQL, Python and some spark knowledge. Hands on Hive (Hadoop) experience.
Strong Knowledge of data architectural approaches, patterns and emerging technologies (RDBMS, Hadoop and Cloud)
Hands on Experience of XML, JSON, Copybook, CSV files ingestion.
Domain Knowledge in financial Services and enterprise functions is strong asset.
Knowledge of Data Governance process for metadata and lineage management is strong asset. Exposure to any Data Governance tools like IGC, Collibra is an asset.
Exposure and knowledge of Cloud platforms, cloud architecture, capabilities and processes like GCP, Azure is great asset.
Ability to translate business needs into technical solutions. Strong Analytical skills.
Experience creating architecture and strategy artifacts
Experience working in Agile environment
Knowledge of database administration, database performance tuning, source & target data structures, ETL processes & products
Bachelor’s Degree, or diploma in computer engineering or information science


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance. 
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community egagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons and much more!


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Torrance

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Decision Support Analyst
Description:
Competition Number: 2025-032

Functional Area: Data & Digital

Location: 200 Front Street W, Toronto Ontario

Job Term: Permanent full-time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Bargaining Unit: AMAPCEO

Job Code: 5A004

Salary Range: $76,231 - $109,842 per year

Posting Status: Open

Posting Date: August 5, 2025




As a Decision Support Analyst, you will be accountable for conducting in-depth analysis of data to provide advice and interpretation for decision-making for an assigned supply chain category.




Other key responsibilities include:

Determining how decision support systems and approach (methodological and technical) will provide information required to make effective business decisions.
Translating requirements into applications that employ appropriate decision support and reporting tools.
Applying knowledge of quantitative and qualitative methods to identify opportunities for strategic sourcing.
Identifying key data elements needed to advance sourcing strategies and other initiatives in collaboration with the category management and supply chain operation teams.
Preparing complex and specialized documentation, reports, dashboards, and statistical analysis on a regular or ad hoc basis to support decision making.
Developing, codifying, and monitoring key performance indicators for measuring success of new and existing business and sourcing initiatives.
Providing analytic and consultative support to a broad spectrum of internal and external business partners.
Maintaining a broad understanding of the assigned category and utilizes that understanding to ensure decision support requirements are achieved.
Supporting Supply Ontario’s customer service standards, enabling client success and business/continuous improvement activities.




Successful candidates will demonstrate the following:

Degree in Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, or related field.
5+ years of experience in writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries for large-scale data environments.
Proficient in building custom data processing logic using SQL and/or Python, including the development of user-defined functions and stored procedures.
Advanced proficiency and experience working with at least one of the following business intelligence, analytics, and reporting tools: Power Bi, Python.
Knowledge of Data Warehousing, ETL, Data Management, Cloud Environments.
Knowledge of Scala/Spark and Agile Methodologies, ideally having worked in an Agile team setting.
Knowledge of analytical techniques including both qualitative and quantitative analysis skills to critically review and analyze complex data and interpret results to identify implications.
Ability to gather, manipulate and analyze high volumes of data from a variety of sources and formulate data into clear, actionable insights and user-friendly visualizations or KPIs
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, VBA etc.).
Ability to present and explain technical information and complex analysis to diverse types of audiences in an easily understood user-friendly manner geared to the target audience.
Excellent consultation and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage work to meet deadlines and manage multiple competing priorities effectively.




Supply Ontario offers a competitive compensation package including benefits and defined benefit pension plan.




The selected candidate will be required to reside and work in Ontario and be legally eligible to work in Canada.

Candidates are required to provide references for verification, and to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

Please apply by August 19, 2025.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Supply Ontario endeavors to promote the principles of diversity and inclusion in all of our policies, practices, and the way we do business while ensuring compliance to the Canadian Human Rights Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code.




We are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve, and to promoting a diverse, inclusive, accessible, respectful, and equitable workplace.

We invite applications from all interested and qualified individuals, from all backgrounds, and walks of life. Your experiences are valuable, and we’re excited to learn how you might be able to lend your skills to further Supply Ontario’s mission and achieving its vision.

At Supply Ontario, we recognize and value the exceptional skills, dedication, and diverse perspectives that veterans bring to the workforce. We strongly encourage veterans to apply to join our team.




We are committed to providing employment practices and accommodation that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Human Rights Code. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process including in relation to the materials and processes to be used, please notify Human Resources at Talent Acquisition (CSCO) talentacquisition@supplyontario.ca.

If you request accommodation, Human Resources will consult with you to provide or arrange for suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account your accommodation needs.

Competition Number: 2025-032

Functional Area: Data & Digital

Location: 200 Front Street W, Toronto Ontario

Job Term: Permanent full-time

Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week

Bargaining Unit: AMAPCEO

Job Code: 5A004

Salary Range: $76,231 - $109,842 per year

Posting Status: Open

Posting Date: August 5, 2025


As a Decision Support Analyst, you will be accountable for conducting in-depth analysis of data to provide advice and interpretation for decision-making for an assigned supply chain category.


Other key responsibilities include:

  • Determining how decision support systems and approach (methodological and technical) will provide information required to make effective business decisions.
  • Translating requirements into applications that employ appropriate decision support and reporting tools.
  • Applying knowledge of quantitative and qualitative methods to identify opportunities for strategic sourcing.
  • Identifying key data elements needed to advance sourcing strategies and other initiatives in collaboration with the category management and supply chain operation teams.
  • Preparing complex and specialized documentation, reports, dashboards, and statistical analysis on a regular or ad hoc basis to support decision making.
  • Developing, codifying, and monitoring key performance indicators for measuring success of new and existing business and sourcing initiatives.
  • Providing analytic and consultative support to a broad spectrum of internal and external business partners.
  • Maintaining a broad understanding of the assigned category and utilizes that understanding to ensure decision support requirements are achieved.
  • Supporting Supply Ontario’s customer service standards, enabling client success and business/continuous improvement activities.


Successful candidates will demonstrate the following:

  • Degree in Computer/Information Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Economics, or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries for large-scale data environments.
  • Proficient in building custom data processing logic using SQL and/or Python, including the development of user-defined functions and stored procedures.
  • Advanced proficiency and experience working with at least one of the following business intelligence, analytics, and reporting tools: Power Bi, Python.
  • Knowledge of Data Warehousing, ETL, Data Management, Cloud Environments.
  • Knowledge of Scala/Spark and Agile Methodologies, ideally having worked in an Agile team setting.
  • Knowledge of analytical techniques including both qualitative and quantitative analysis skills to critically review and analyze complex data and interpret results to identify implications.
  • Ability to gather, manipulate and analyze high volumes of data from a variety of sources and formulate data into clear, actionable insights and user-friendly visualizations or KPIs
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, VBA etc.).
  • Ability to present and explain technical information and complex analysis to diverse types of audiences in an easily understood user-friendly manner geared to the target audience.
  • Excellent consultation and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to manage work to meet deadlines and manage multiple competing priorities effectively.


Supply Ontario offers a competitive compensation package including benefits and defined benefit pension plan.

Title: Analyst, Data Strategy and Analytics
Description:
Proudly Canadian-owned, Enercare is committed to providing the best services, solutions and advice to make customer’s homes as comfortable as they can be. With Enercare Advantage, we provide affordable clean air and water solutions for homes and workplaces. We are committed to operating in an environmentally responsible way, including keeping as much waste out of landfills as possible, and giving back to the communities where we live and work. Enercare is about putting people first by listening to our customers, continuous improvement and making our organization a destination for building people’s careers.

Come and join one of North America's largest home and commercial services and energy solutions companies! We offer comprehensive benefits, a DC Pension Plan and savings match plan. If you are passionate about joining an organization committed to delivering 5 Star Customer Service, we would love to hear from you.

Role: Analyst, Data Strategy & Analytics

Reports to: Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Analytics

Status: Permanent, Full-Time

Division: Enercare Home and Commercial Services

Location: Markham

Summary

Reporting to Lead/Senior Manager, Data Strategy & Analytics, you will play a key role in a highly visible team within the organization to advance our business as we execute our data strategy. This is a great opportunity for an individual with a passion for using data to drive insights, presenting key learnings, and delivering transformational outcomes to our business.

You are an inquisitive and intellectually curious individual with analytics experience, excellent communications skills and good business acumen. With an agile-mindset, you are obsessed with data quality, pragmatic algorithms, as well as enjoy learning our business and operations with a go-and-see approach.

Accountabilities


Support ad-hoc analyses and dataset extraction for project support
Monitor business as usual tasks and activities. Detect and fix any issues related to daily reporting
Support and enhance of existing reports and dashboards based on evolving business needs
Have an open mind and a knack to collaborate effectively across internal and external partners to further capitalize on data assets
Handle ambiguity and apply first principles with structured approaches to solving problems


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree with exceptional academic standing, and/or master’s degree(s) in an analytical discipline such as: mathematics, applied science and engineering, physics, computer science, management analytics, data science
1+ years of professional experience in analytics or other quantitative disciplines
1+ years in SQL, Excel & VBA is a must
Experience in problem solving and analytical skills to develop creative, unique and pragmatic approaches and solutions to address complex problems
Technology experience in one or more of the following: SQL, Excel, VBA; Data visualization tools such as Power BI; Cloud services platform (e.g, Azure, AWS)
Business domain knowledge in one or more of the following: Sales, Call Center Operations, Billing and Collections, Accounting and Finance
Experience cleaning, transforming and processing data sets
Excellent verbal and written communications skills


Enercare is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship, marital status, disability, pregnancy, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law. Enercare’s recruitment process includes accommodation for applicants with disabilities in accordance with applicable provincial accessibility laws and regulations. All accommodations will take into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability and are available upon request.

Title: Senior Analyst, Reporting Planning & Forecasting
Description:
Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued – as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the country's largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well®.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Why This Role is Important:

In the Customer Support Centre of Excellence (CoE), we strive to provide PC Financial, PC Optimum, Loblaw Digital, Loblaw Retail, and SDM Retail customers an effortless experience in the moments that matter. We use technology, automation, and delivery optimization to improve customer and colleague experiences. We collaborate with technology and products teams to build harmony and deliver value. We are forward-thinking, agile, and cooperative, solving complex problems at pace. We run as one team, value diversity and dig deep to always know more.

Reporting to the Manager, Customer Care Reporting, Forecast, & Analytics, this role will be maximising different data sources to support operations and financials of the Optimum & Retail contact centres. It will also include collaborating closely with both internal and external stakeholders. We are looking for a candidate that is a self-starter, with high attention to detail, excellent computer skills, and a curious personality.

What You'll Do:

CoE Operational Performance


Maintain and develop necessary operational and performance reports for the lines of business
Identify trends and averages on volumes daily, weekly, monthly and seasonal basis
Develop and maintain historical data (e.g. absenteeism, attrition, management investment, call volume, productivity, service level performance, and staffing adherence etc.)
Filling adhoc reporting needs for business & present results in a concise, decisive format for various stakeholders
Ability to integrate various data streams into a coherent, accurate view of program activities
Review /Assess incoming requests for analysis and data extracts from JIRA board – provide outputs accurately and support with recommendations.
Work where needed with the Salesforce automation teams/data teams to automate reports or build the requests for data extractions.


Financial Performance & Insights


Supervise monthly / period financial performance and provide insights to improve
Assist with development of the performance decks (Including PBRs) with accuracy and provide commentary to support variances to plan and LE
Support annual planning and periodic LE submissions with data extractions and models
Review Salesforce case management to help control costs
Monthly accruals for Retail and PCO


Forecasting and Planning – Contact Volumes and Resources


Track and analyze historical volumes and patterns, and agent performance metrics (schedule compliance, absenteeism, average handle time)
Work with cross-functional teams within the business to improve customer service processes


Onboard, Offboarding, & Access Controls


Process & set up new hire colleagues in all systems required within the COE across all lines of business
Ensure offboarding of colleagues in real time to ensure security of all systems
Troubleshoot any access control issues that arise and work with various stakeholders to get corrected
Maintain staffing lists amongst the COE and any vendors.


What You Bring:


University Degree in an analytical field such as Economics or Business, or equivalent experience.
Intermediate/advanced Excel Skills (Advanced formulas such as Sumifs/Countifs), as well as an interest in data manipulation
Strong attention to detail
Salesforce usage and Salesforce reporting skills are as asset
Call centre experience is an asset
VBA, or SQL skills an asset
Excellent communication, presentation, and social skills
Quantitatively driven


Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars – Environment, Sourcing and Community – and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values – Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence – guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits – these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada’s Top Employers, Canada’s Best Diversity Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers & Canada’s Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.

Please Note:

Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

#EN

Title: Digital Analytics Consulting
Description:
We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our team.

Requirements:


Analyzing website traffic, user behaviour, and campaign performance to provide actionable insights and recommendations
Experience using web analytics platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), data visualization tools, and potentially programming languages like Python
Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and draw meaningful conclusions
Collaborate with clients to understand their objectives, develop measurement strategies, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and optimize online presence.
Providing recommendations for improving website usability, optimizing marketing campaigns, and enhancing overall online presence
Assist with the implementation of tracking code, customizing analytics solutions, and ensuring data accuracy
Create reports to communicate findings to clients and stakeholders, highlighting key trends and insights
Ability to identify issues and propose solutions.


Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree
3-5 years of relevant digital marketing experience
Agency experience is an asset
Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal and the ability to collaborate with a cross functional team in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment
Ability to multitask and complete deadlines in a fast-paced, challenging environment

Title: Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

At Momentum Financial Services Group, we help people move forward by reimagining how money works for those who need it most. With more than 40 years of experience, we're the team behind Money Mart—Canada's largest non-bank branch network—and a leader in financial solutions for underserved communities.

From short-term loans to money transfers and prepaid cards, we power the products, technology, and operations that connect over a million customers a year to the money they need, when they need it.

At MFSG, we come together across teams and departments to create something bigger than ourselves: solutions that remove barriers and give people access to money they might not get anywhere else. Whether you're solving problems, building systems, or shaping strategy, your work fuels real support for real people.

We've Got You Covered


Compensation Philosophy: Our strategy is simple—we aim to match the market. We regularly review industry standards to ensure our total rewards package is competitive and fair. This commitment helps us attract and retain talented individuals who share our purpose.
Discretionary Annual Bonus: Enjoy the opportunity for a discretionary bonus based on individual performance and company success.
Comprehensive Benefits: Our benefits include health and dental plans with 100% of the premiums covered. We also offer an Employee Assistance Program to support your mental well-being and provide resources for personal challenges.
Retirement Plans: Plan for your future with our robust retirement savings options, ensuring you're set for the long haul.
Hybrid Work Environment: Experience the best of both worlds with our hybrid work model, allowing you to balance remote work with in-office. When you're at our corporate head office, enjoy a relaxed and collaborative environment featuring breakout rooms for brainstorming and unwinding, plus a variety of snacks to keep you energized throughout the day.
Perks and Rewards: Enjoy reimbursement for tuition assistance and professional development, discounts through Perkopolis and participate in our rewards and recognition programs to celebrate your contributions.


The Job: Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics

We're looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Sr. Analyst, Data Analytics to join our growing Risk Group in Toronto. Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Analytics, you'll be the subject matter data expert—translating raw data into actionable insights, strategies, and solutions that drive both business success and customer outcomes. You'll work closely with stakeholders across departments to improve data processes, develop impactful reports and dashboards, and apply advanced analytics techniques to uncover trends and opportunities.

What You'll Do

Turn Data Into Actionable Insights:


Analyze large, complex datasets from multiple sources to produce accurate business metric reporting.
Conduct advanced statistical, financial, and predictive analyses to identify trends, patterns, and business opportunities.
Utilize statistical modeling, predictive analytics, and machine learning to provide deeper insights into business operations and market conditions.


Build & Optimize Reporting Tools:


Design, develop, and maintain purpose-driven reports and dashboards using Tableau, Power BI, or Excel.
Identify inefficiencies in current data processes and implement improvements to enhance accuracy and efficiency.
Create visually compelling presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels.


Collaborate Across the Business:


Lead regular touchpoints with business stakeholders to go beyond requested deliverables—proactively suggesting data-driven solutions to improve workflows.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet business objectives.
Support the Sr. Manager of Analytics in defining key metrics, performance targets, and project priorities for the department.


Elevate the Analytics Function:


Continuously broaden your knowledge of different business verticals and how they use data to drive decision-making.
Ensure all analysis and reporting maintain the highest level of accuracy and attention to detail.


What You'll Bring to the Table


Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to manage the full analytics lifecycle—from descriptive and diagnostic analysis to predictive and prescriptive solutions.
Proven experience interpreting large datasets and presenting insights in a clear, actionable manner.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
A proactive, curious mindset with a drive to continuously improve processes and deliverables.
Strong business judgment and the ability to think both creatively and strategically.
Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.


Education + Experience


Bachelor's degree or higher in Decision Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Finance, or Economics.
3+ years of experience in reporting, analysis, and strategy development—preferably in the financial services industry.
Proven proficiency in SQL, R, Python, or similar data mining and analytics tools.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, or Microsoft SSRS.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, macros, and data analysis tools.


Ready to apply your data expertise to make a real impact? Join us and help shape the future of analytics at MFSG. Apply today and let's build the future of MFSG, together.

#SJ

  • Identify inefficiencies in current data processes and implement improvements to enhance accuracy and efficiency.
  • Create visually compelling presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders at all levels.

Collaborate Across the Business:

  • Lead regular touchpoints with business stakeholders to go beyond requested deliverables—proactively suggesting data-driven solutions to improve workflows.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver solutions that meet business objectives.
  • Support the Sr. Manager of Analytics in defining key metrics, performance targets, and project priorities for the department.

Elevate the Analytics Function:

  • Continuously broaden your knowledge of different business verticals and how they use data to drive decision-making.
  • Ensure all analysis and reporting maintain the highest level of accuracy and attention to detail.

What You'll Bring to the Table

  • Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills with a high degree of accuracy.
  • Ability to manage the full analytics lifecycle—from descriptive and diagnostic analysis to predictive and prescriptive solutions.
  • Proven experience interpreting large datasets and presenting insights in a clear, actionable manner.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • A proactive, curious mindset with a drive to continuously improve processes and deliverables.
  • Strong business judgment and the ability to think both creatively and strategically.
  • Ability to work both autonomously and collaboratively in a cross-functional environment.

Education + Experience

  • Bachelor's degree or higher in Decision Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Finance, or Economics.
  • 3+ years of experience in reporting, analysis, and strategy development—preferably in the financial services industry.
  • Proven proficiency in SQL, R, Python, or similar data mining and analytics tools.
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, or Microsoft SSRS.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, macros, and data analysis tools.

Ready to apply your data expertise to make a real impact? Join us and help shape the future of analytics at MFSG. Apply today and let's build the future of MFSG, together.

#SJ

Title: Associate, Business Intelligence (12-month contract)
Description:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization

When you join CPP Investments, you are joining one of the world’s most admired and respected institutional investors. As a professional investment management organization, CPP Investments invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure its financial sustainability for generations of working and retired Canadians.

CPP Investments invests across regions and asset classes to build a globally diversified portfolio. It holds assets in public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, and fixed income, and the CPP Fund is projected to reach $3.6 trillion in assets by 2050. The organization is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo, and Sydney.

CPP Investments successfully attracts, selects, and retains talented individuals from top-tier institutions worldwide. Join our team for access to:


Stimulating work in a fast-paced and intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
A hybrid-flexible work environment with an emphasis on in-person collaboration
A culture rooted in principles of integrity, partnership, and high performance
An organization with an important social purpose that positively impacts lives


If you have a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach work with the highest integrity, invest your career here.

Job Description

As an Associate, Business Intelligence, you will gather, analyze, manage, and report on financial related data to provide actionable insights and recommendations to stakeholders, supporting their strategic decision-making processes. You will also deliver visual and dynamic analytical solutions by providing an integrated and independent view of key metrics with self-serve monitoring dashboards and reports.

Team Description

The team plays a vital role in delivering high-impact insights and solutions that support the Fund’s long-term performance and operational excellence. We sit at the intersection of data, technology, and strategic decision-making - collaborating with investment professionals, functional teams, and senior leaders across the organization. The team fosters a collaborative environment that encourages learning, mentorship, and cross-functional engagement. Whether we're enhancing portfolio analytics, improving operational workflows, or developing new capabilities, our work is grounded in CPP Investments’ core values of integrity, partnership, and high performance.

Accountabilities


Support Product Owners with leading the analysis, prioritization, planning and delivery of new features and capabilities based on user needs.
Business analysis and Data Analysis to support requirement documentation for data extraction, profiling, transformation, and validation tasks.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and actionable insights from large datasets
Design and maintain data validation checks to ensure high-quality and reliable datasets.
Participate in testing of technology deliverables (e.g., user acceptance testing) and support documentation of results.
Partner effectively with multiple stakeholders to deliver effective and compelling presentations, creating advanced visual displays of complex quantitative information.
Independently develop and automate advanced reports, iteratively building and prototyping dashboards to provide insights at scale for complex situations, solving for analytical needs.
Lead and assist in the infrastructure for the storage, integration, and use of data and databases with the team.
Lead conversations with groups inside and outside the department to procure data, resolve technical challenges, and align on data needs, roles & responsibilities.
Manage your own workload to perform time-sensitive requests accurately and on time, while building effective working relationships within your team and across various groups at CPP Investments.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analytics and reporting to enhance skills and capabilities.


Qualifications


Undergraduate degree or college diploma in related field
5+ year of relevant experience
Relevant professional designation (e.g., MBA, CPA or CFA) or progression toward one considered an asset.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience working with SQL and working knowledge of Python is nice to have
Demonstrated ability to produce insightful analysis of business issues and suggest potential solutions for complex situations.
Knowledge and/or experience of Agile and Product Management concepts considered an asset.
Advanced experience working with large data sets, using superior analytical skills, having a strong attention to detail and ability to communicate complex topics


Additional Information

Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn.

At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.

Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Disclaimer

CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.

Title: Principal Data Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD89399

The French translation can be found below!/La traduction en français se trouve ci-dessous!

Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform’s business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Principal Data Analyst to join Autodesk’s Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization. This role reports to the Sr. Manager, Data Analytics.

Preference for candidates to work hybrid/remote from Toronto or Montreal offices.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed
Mentor and support junior analysts by providing technical guidance, sharing best practices, and fostering a culture of continuous learning within the team


Minimum Qualifications


8+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling. Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline


Description Du Poste

Autodesk a investi dans la prise de décision basée sur les données afin d'optimiser les activités, les produits et les coûts de notre plateforme. Les cinq prochaines années vont transformer notre façon de travailler, avec une augmentation considérable du volume de données et le développement de l'IA/ML afin d'offrir encore plus de valeur à nos clients. Nous recherchons un analyste de données principal pour rejoindre l'équipe Stratégie de plateforme et technologies émergentes d'Autodesk dans cette aventure transformatrice et pour favoriser la prise de décision basée sur les données grâce à des analyses et des informations avancées.

Vous êtes passionné par la fourniture d'informations proactives et par la collaboration avec les parties prenantes afin de générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route des produits. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes produit en mettant en évidence des données précieuses sur les clients et l'utilisation des produits et en agissant comme un partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant pour transformer ces informations en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte de tendances et la traduction de flux de données volumineux en informations claires et exploitables permettra de faire avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et d'améliorer la prise de décision dans toute notre organisation. Ce poste est rattaché au directeur principal de l'analyse des données.

Une préférence sera accordée aux candidats pouvant travailler en mode hybride/à distance depuis les bureaux de Toronto ou de Montréal.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée de donner aux équipes les moyens d'agir et d'influencer l'organisation grâce à des informations qui favorisent la réussite, ce poste est fait pour vous !

Responsabilités


Collaborer avec les chefs de produit et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et opportunités commerciaux grâce à l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour tirer des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes
Surveiller et suivre les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) et les objectifs et résultats clés (OKR) de toutes les initiatives de la plateforme, fournir des mises à jour régulières et des informations aux principales parties prenantes et garantir la visibilité des informations basées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes produit, ingénierie et commerciales afin de comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, leur fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats de manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
Rechercher de manière proactive des informations basées sur les données afin de soutenir les initiatives de la plateforme PSET, en mettant l'accent sur les performances, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'activité
Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données et des analyses statistiques avancés pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus décisionnels dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, afin d'obtenir des informations de haute qualité. Identifier et résoudre les incohérences dans les données si nécessaire
Encadrer et soutenir les analystes juniors en leur fournissant des conseils techniques, en partageant les meilleures pratiques et en favorisant une culture d'apprentissage continu au sein de l'équipe


Qualifications Minimales


Au moins 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données volumineuses, la veille économique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
Licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
Solides compétences en matière de requêtes et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise des langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données. Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Connaissance d'AWS, Azure ou de plateformes cloud similaires
Compétences avérées en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des informations exploitables
Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation permettant d'obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et de soutenir l'analyse prédictive
Solide capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des informations et des recommandations complexes sur les données à des parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
Esprit d'équipe efficace, avec une forte capacité à travailler de manière transversale, à interagir avec diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien fondé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques


Qualifications Souhaitées


Une expérience préalable dans une entreprise SaaS ou une organisation d'ingénierie de plateformes est souhaitable
La connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs est un atout
Master dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe


Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Diversity & Belonging / Diversité et appurtenance

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Nous sommes fiers de cultiver une culture d’appartenance et un milieu de travail équitable où tout le monde peut s’épanouir. Pour en savoir plus, cliquez ici : https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Êtes-vous un sous-traitant ou un consultant existant d’Autodesk ?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

Veuillez rechercher des emplois vacants et postuler à l’interne (pas sur ce site externe).
Show more

  • Collaborer avec les chefs de produit et les équipes interfonctionnelles afin d'identifier, de définir et de résoudre les problèmes et opportunités commerciaux grâce à l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour tirer des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes
  • Surveiller et suivre les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) et les objectifs et résultats clés (OKR) de toutes les initiatives de la plateforme, fournir des mises à jour régulières et des informations aux principales parties prenantes et garantir la visibilité des informations basées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes produit, ingénierie et commerciales afin de comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, leur fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats de manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
  • Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
  • Rechercher de manière proactive des informations basées sur les données afin de soutenir les initiatives de la plateforme PSET, en mettant l'accent sur les performances, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'activité
  • Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données et des analyses statistiques avancés pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus décisionnels dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
  • Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, afin d'obtenir des informations de haute qualité. Identifier et résoudre les incohérences dans les données si nécessaire
  • Encadrer et soutenir les analystes juniors en leur fournissant des conseils techniques, en partageant les meilleures pratiques et en favorisant une culture d'apprentissage continu au sein de l'équipe

Qualifications Minimales

  • Au moins 8 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de données volumineuses, la veille économique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
  • Licence dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
  • Solides compétences en matière de requêtes et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise des langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données. Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Connaissance d'AWS, Azure ou de plateformes cloud similaires
  • Compétences avérées en matière d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des informations exploitables
  • Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation permettant d'obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et de soutenir l'analyse prédictive
  • Solide capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des informations et des recommandations complexes sur les données à des parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
  • Esprit d'équipe efficace, avec une forte capacité à travailler de manière transversale, à interagir avec diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien fondé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques

Qualifications Souhaitées

  • Une expérience préalable dans une entreprise SaaS ou une organisation d'ingénierie de plateformes est souhaitable
  • La connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs est un atout
  • Master dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Diversity & Belonging / Diversité et appurtenance

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Nous sommes fiers de cultiver une culture d’appartenance et un milieu de travail équitable où tout le monde peut s’épanouir. Pour en savoir plus, cliquez ici : https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Êtes-vous un sous-traitant ou un consultant existant d’Autodesk ?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

Veuillez rechercher des emplois vacants et postuler à l’interne (pas sur ce site externe).

Title: Data Analytics Lead Analyst
Description:
Team/Role Overview

The Internal Audit (IA) Central Transformation team is an integral part of the broader IA Transformation team with a mandate to coordinate, drive and report on Internal Audit's assurance efforts across Citi's transformation.

The Lead Business Analyst is an intermediate level role responsible for performing moderate to complex data analytics, reporting and process automation.

Responsibilities:


Prepare regular and time sensitive analytics, visualizations, and reports for senior management and the Board.
Synthesize and communicate moderate to complex risk metrics.
Analyze, implement, and automate underlying data, data flows, and data controls to enhance processes and efficiency.
Design and develop interactive Tableau dashboards.
Support the development and enhancement of metrics reporting processes within IA Transformation including the optimization / automation of reporting processes.
Prepare regulatory responses for IA Transformation related metrics.
Work closely with internal and external business partners in building, implementing, tracking, and improving decision strategies.
Coordinate regulatory meetings specific to the broader IA Transformation teams.
Support the Leadership Team to drive efficiencies and simplification through the identification and implementation of automation opportunities.
Execute on other data driven tasks as assigned by the IA Leadership team.


Qualifications:


7+ years' experience of relevant experience in data analytics, data visualization and reporting.
Advanced and Current Microsoft Excel Experience Required.
Experience in Tableau, Power BI or equivalent preferred.
Skills in data analytics, databases, data quality.
Coding in Python, R, SAS (or related statistics programs) preferred, but not required.
Experience in SQL, VBA or other programming language is a plus.
Knowledge of audits is a plus, but not required.
Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills.
Effective project management skills.
Effective influencing and relationship management skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with multiple senior stakeholders


Education:


Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, Master's degree preferred but is not required


------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:

Technology

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:

Data Analytics

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:

Full time

------------------------------------------------------

Most Relevant Skills

Please see the requirements listed above.

------------------------------------------------------

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities Assist in the refinement of reporting requirements
Develop, test, and implement reports and supplemental processes to support reports for Consumer Risk Management and North American Collections, utilizing the Microsoft stack of tools (MS SQL Server, MS Reporting Services, MS Excel)
Modify/Enhance existing reports
Lead reporting projects as needed
Source required information and assist in the development of processes to retrieve data from external sources
Create Ad Hoc reports as needed
Participate in departmental Round-Table discussions to inform group of changes/enhancements to business processes that they may not be aware of
Participate/Assist in departmental cross-training program to disseminate knowledge/expertise across department personnel
Perform reporting maintenance tasks as required by department manager
Experience (Years): 4-6
Essential Skills: The Reporting Analyst role is a full time, permanent role located in Wes Allis, Wisconsin.
Responsible for development, production, documentation, and support of accurate and meaningful daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc reports for various internal and external stakeholder groups.
The primary internal stakeholders are Consumer Risk Management and North American Collections. The mandate also requires performing investigations or analysis to identify or resolve identified issues.
The role requires a self-starter who will reach out stakeholders, to review existing processes, offering suggestions for improvement in automation or system enhancements and/or performance measures etc.
Solutions may involve creating new reports, data sets, dashboards, assisting in the automation of manual processes, or building tools to aid business users.
This position is responsible for assisting in the determination of report requirements, gathering data from various sources, transforming the data into useful information by creating meaningful reports and dashboards, and completing documentation to support the report and supplemental processes.

Title: Data Analyst 0370-1212
Description:
HM Note: This hybrid contract role is three (3) days in office. Candidates resume must include first and last name.

Description

Background Information

The resources being requested will hold the business title of Lead, Data Specialist and will be responsible for the review, evaluation and readiness of data contributed to the Agency's Immunization Repository (IR).

The development and population of an Immunization Repository is a cornerstone within MOHs âone immunization record (Immunization Repository)' priority and is in line with Ontario's desired immunization future state. This work will be one of the forthcoming projects in the Immunization Repository Optimization Program, one of the key components of the Public Health Digital Platform (under Clinical Care Service delivery).

Must Haves


5 â 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and business intelligence
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies
3 â 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with health system technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.
Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred


Responsibilities


Works in partnership with clients, advising them on information technology in order to meet their business objectives or overcome problems, work to improve structure and efficiency of an organization's I&IT systems.
The I&IT Consultant may be used to provide strategic guidance to organizations with regard to Information Management & IT technology, IT infrastructures and the enablement of major business processes through enhancements to IT.
Provides subject matter expertise in their field and highly expert technical assistance.


General Skills


Acts as the technical advisor/expert on all aspects of a specific deliverable
Provide the quality assurance/quality control of specific deliverables
Anticipates and resolves problems to ensure that the deliverables are completed within budget, to the highest quality, meeting or exceeding expectations
Develops processes and procedures for implementing deliverables
Prepares reports and presentations including options, recommendations, implementation plans, etc.
Works with clients to define the scope of a project and to determine requirements
Defines software, hardware and network requirements
Analyzes I&IT requirements giving independent and objective advice on the use of I&IT
Designs, tests, installs and monitors new systems and develops solutions and implementation of new systems
Familiar with change-management principles and methodology
Knowledge and understanding of Information Management principles, concepts, policies and practices
Demonstrates excellent time management, with the ability to manage tight deadlines and prioritize multiple projects.
Apply knowledge of Health Standard message conformance tooling (e.g., Caristix, XMLSpy, 7Edit, etc.).
Experience managing programs with large complex governance structures and many stakeholders.


Required Experience / Evaluation Criteria


5 â 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and/or business intelligence.: 25 Points
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies.: 25 Points
3 â 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.: 20 Points
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with Health System technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.: 20 Points
Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred.: 10 Points


Deliverables


The resource will be responsible for the review, evaluation and readiness of data contributed to the Agency's current and future repositories as well as specific deliverables including:
Working with Ministry to Profile Panorama data, estimate durations, and assess readiness for migration to EHR-IR.
Mapping data fields and transformation logic to EHR-IR.
Aligning and documenting validation rules and business logic across systems.
Defining data quality metrics and reporting requirements for post-migration monitoring.
Documentation deliverables including:
Data migration specification (Proof of Concept)
Implementation Plan (Proof of Concept)
Sample Data Extracts
Data Mapping Specification
Data Quality Monitoring and Reporting Plan
Documentation of all deliverables as well as knowledge transfer at the end of the assignment


Knowledge Transfer Details


The resource will ensure full knowledge transfer is provided to the Ontario Health team before end of engagement. Some of this might occur at the end of the engagement but will also be shared as information is obtained/consolidated. Key deliverables will be shared with team.
The resource must provide all related documentation as part of Knowledge transfer protocol. Documents will be reviewed by the appropriate leads and signed off by manager/director.
The resource will work collaboratively with the Ontario Health team throughout the assignment and ensure key deliverables, milestones, and documentation are shared.
A walkthrough of any demos, development, etc. will be required before the end of the engagement.


Must Haves


5 â 7 years of experience in data analysis, data management and business intelligence
5 - 7 years working and applied knowledge of healthcare systems, healthcare integration standards such as HL7/FHIR, XML messaging principles, techniques and technologies
3 â 5 years of demonstrated clinical data expertise in both project based and operational responsibilities.
3-5 years of demonstrated experience working with health system technologies (e.g. HIS technologies, LIS, EMR); including Integration Engines or Interface technologies.


Nice To Have


Knowledge or experience with immunization workflows and associated business processes within pharmacies, hospitals or health records, preferred
